review: Does Red Robin make the best burgers?  IMHO, they're very good, not the best I've ever had, but here's why we've become loyal fans of this national chain:  1. Convenient location.  The Skokie restaurant is in a strip mall just around the corner from a multiplex cinema and has ample parking. 2. Extensive menu.  The burger selection features a mind-boggling array of combos and toppings, but the menu also offers other sandwiches and wraps, apps, entrées, and entrée-size salads.  Our faves include the Shrimp & Cod Duo and the BBQ Chicken Wrap. 3.  Service.  Consistently friendly and considerate.  Due to the enormity of menu options, mistakes happen.  On our most recent visit, the kitchen botched a sandwich.  While it was being remade (and without our asking or complaining), the server whisked a plate of fries to our table and then the manager stopped by to apologize.  She also comped the sandwich. 4. Walls.  That's right, this restaurant is divided into 3 rooms:  Families with children, teens and millennials, and the 21+ bar crowd.  Brilliant!  I sure wish more restaurants would do this. 5.  Bottomless fries.  'Nuff said. 6.  Red Robin Royalty. This is one of the better incentive programs out there.  You get a free Gourmet Burger during your birthday month, and freebies and discounts by email all year long.  The cost to sign up is free. 7.  Ziosk.  The interactive touchscreens found on each table are fun.

I came here on a Sunday night with a friend for a quick bite. I like Red Robin if you're in the mood for a nice burger and fries for a reasonable price.  Service was just okay, our server did not come by and check on us as much as I would have liked considering it wasn't busy when we were there.  I ordered a burger with sweet potato fries and I love that they offer endless fries with almost every order!

The appetizers are good and the burger was decent even though you cant get it cooked to your liking such as medium, med rare etc. your only options are pink or no pink. Why such a low rating? Because our sever Amanda absolutely sucked!  The place was not busy yet her service was mediocre. She made a drink that tasted like nothing but sour mix, never came to refill our waters or to check on us to ask how the food was or if we needed anything and didn't even bother to say goodbye or have a nice night or anything as she saw us leaving. The little 7$ tip we left was way too much.....she deserved nothing.

Was my first experience at this wonderful burger place. Wanted to go here for years and finally it was destiny that brought me here today. Ordered the newly introduced Veggie Burger and was very happy with it. The bottomless fries and the ability to order different ones is awesome . Would definitely recommend Red Robin if in mood of a quality burger.

For starters we had a tower of onion rings with two different sauces. For my meal I had the black and blue turkey burger and bottomless fries. I was so full from my three onion rings that I could only take a small bite of my burger. However, what I did manage to eat was very tasty. My long island ice tea was just juice and tasted as if no alcohol was in it. The service was very attentive and responsive. Would return again but wouldn't order an alcoholic beverage.

This is my go to spot for a good burger and fries. I've tried a few of the burgers and all of them were great! The fries are also awesome but will be better if you get the campfire sauce. As for this location, I've never had issues with the service. Everyone's always nice!

Awesome burgers, bar, fries, and beer. This place is nice. It is clean. The bathrooms are good. The TVs are nice to see at the bar. Not bad draft prices. A birthday burger month is neat. Burgers are great tasting.  Just remember to ask for the Tabasco. They have unlimited steak fries which is neat. You'll definitely get full from two servings of steak fries and the burger meal plus drinks.

I am not sure why I was so excited to try burger place and this probably was not the best to try.  I ordered the Garden burger on a Ciabatta bread.  IT WAS COLD! The burger patty was not even warm not was the bread.  For appetizers we ordered the pretzel bites and onion rings and both were not great.  The cheese sauce on the pretzel bites was so disgusting.  Let's just say that my favorite thing was the house ranch......  Probably would give a 1 star but the server was very nice so added a star for her.  FOOD SUCKED...

Well I have been hearing about Red Robin from my sister Susan S. (Yelp Elite) for awhile so I thought I check it out.  As usual we were on the way home driving past Village Crossing on Central and as we were driving past it I said we really need to check Red Robin out sometime.  My wife surprised me by saying oh do you want to.  No sooner were the words uttered and I was pulling a U Turn going back to the restaurant that we just passed.   We arrived there this evening and had to do a double take because there were so many kids.  I thought I walked into a Chuckie Cheese by mistake. I ordered the Smoke & Pepper angus burger on a ciabatta bun w/cheddar cheese, bacon & bbque sauce.  The angus burger cooked medium rare the way I like my meat.  It was exquisite, great quality meat blended with cheddar (because everything is better w/cheddar)  bacon & bbque sauce.  The ciabatta bun gave the burger the slightly chewy texture that I really like.   My wife ordered a basic Red Robin burger cooked medium and that in itself took out a lot of the flavor in what I consider an over cooked burger (NEVER OVER COOK YOUR MEAT).  Both burgers came with unlimited steak fries, but for me it's not a huge selling point because I don't eat fries very often.  Still it is a nice selling feature Red Robin holds its burger ingredients to very strict standards; the beef is always fresh and never frozen, all-natural, domestic, and free of preservatives and added ingredients; and the produce is GMO-free.

Well this one star is generous.  After an evening seeing a tree lighting we just wanted to go somewhere for an easy meal like a burger where we could also get a drink with our child.  This restaurant ruined that dream.  After being sat by an unhappy hostess we then waited at least 25 minutes with NO ONE greeting us ever.  We had hit the call server button on the little piece of technology on the table and had to hit it a second time as no one came for the cycle of time it was blinking red.  During this time waiting I saw our server make sure and check in with at least three different tables he had who were finishing up more than once.  This included 2 tables next to us where we could have at least acknowledged us.  There was a woman who appeared to be a manager who could have come by while our red lighting was going off and greeted us but no, she wanted to bus tables, but it wasn't because people were waiting to be sat.  This was my first time here and I can say I have not even gotten to try a glass of water here, a doubt I will ever step into Red Robin again.

Ok, this is really a problem with Amazon, but I had some things wrong in my order as well. I had Amazon delivery cued and ordered the food. It said 1 hour and we waited. And waited. And waited. I called Red Robin and got a pretty nasty man on the phone who told me to "come pick it up" at 8:15 pm. I asked him when it would be delivered. He did not know, it is sitting here. I was pretty upset. I called Amazon twice so I could find out the status and they wanted me to cancel the order! Finally I called to cancel and got the driver. She told me it was not received until 8:30 which is a full 1.5 hours from ordering. She was on her way. She came and we got the VERY COLD food. The root beer float was a mess. This cost me $35 mind you...for two people! There were no napkins, no forks, no condiments, no onion rings and so the entire thing was a clustering mess. The driver was nice and apologized, but I am not sure she was telling the truth about getting the order at 8:30 since when I called the dude said yes, the food is sitting here at 8:15 pm. Needless to say, I will NEVER go there again.

I like this place. My wife and I have (had) three go to places for date night. This was one of them. (Still would be, but we moved. If we are ever in the area, we will go here again.) the burgers are good, the appetisers are great, and the booze are cold. What more can I ask for.

My family has been coming to this location for years and loves the wide variety of burgers on the Red Robin menu. The unlimited fries are a big draw, too. The service has been good at this location, even though we usually come on Saturday nights when they are packed. The last time I came however, I had an all-around terrible experience that really soured me on this location. With our one-year-old in tow, my wife and I were seated relatively quickly, but there was a bitterly cold draft emanating from the ceiling above us  We asked no less than four times--the hostess twice and our server twice--to get it turned down or reseat us. Nothing changed throughout the course of the meal, despite the waitress' insistence that she was doing something about it. In addition, we don't really see our waitress much once the food arrived, so I spent most of my meal with an empty Come and the unlimited fries are decidedly more limited when no one shows up to refill them. Thankfully another server took pity on me and made it happen. Beyond the service, the restaurant was filthy. There was salt from a giant pretzel all over the floor under our table. As we were leaving, my wife noticed broken glass mixed in to the mess under our table as well. Before leaving, I went to the men's room  On my way in, I noted a giant pile and trail of salt or sugar on the floor leading to the men's room. Yum! My final experience took the cake though. As I stood at the urinal, an employee--who had delivered our food--emerged from the stall, walked to the sink, quickly rinsed his hands without using soap, and left. I talked to the manager after this because I couldn't take it anymore and she said that I should have told her what was going on during our meal, not afterward. She also thankfully asked me to point out the guy with the potty hands. She gave me a coupon for a free appetizer, but I'm pretty sure I won't be using it at this location. Yuck!

Tried Red Robin for the first time and it quickly became apparent that I was not missing anything.  Service was extremely poor, despite the fact that it was not busy.   In regard to the food, the burgers we ordered were truly no better than what we could have ordered at Burger King for a third of the price.  Steak fries were completely tasteless and had no seasoning.  Absolutely no reason to return to this or any other Red Robin ever again.

VERDICT: Decent place for overpriced food and drinks.  The food is good but nothing special, and the cooks will get your burger meat exactly how you want it done whether you like it well or if you like it more rare.  The ambiance is cool and a bit intimate with the dimly lit lights.. Kinda bar-like lighting .. Seating is good.  Pros:  -Great Service -Great atmosphere -Hustle and bustle, always busy, tons of people -Good for a date for young people Cons: -Pricey food -Don't offer any type of steaks or alternatives to burgers except Salmon -Not many options on the menu besides burgers despite it being a dine-in restaurant environment. -Sometimes there's a wait to be seated..  This might sound a bit rude: but in all honesty, my friends told me I make better burgers at home.. P.S. Between 2 people and without desserts or any extras our tab was 56$ before tips.

So sad that the service was so bad that a couple with a young child had to leave after waiting for over 30 minutes. We were very disappointed with the service and will probably never go back. I felt sorry for the waitress who was trying to take care of the lunch floor with no assistance.

The food is basic. The waitress was very nice but the food is not worth it. I had an Oreo shake which was great but my sweet potato fries were bland and my cheeseburger was average.. will not be coming back unless it's for a shake or dessert...

We decided on this for our dinner after realizing the line to Jollibee was still out the door. I had fond memories of Red Robin from when I lived on the East Coast and this experience was far from what I remembered. Our shoes slid on the greasy floor, the service lacked motivation, flies circled us as we had our meal. I chose onion rings as my side (not unlimited and for an up charge) only to find 5 rings beside my lack luster burger. Save your time and money and go elsewhere for a burger.

Here's what you need to know: This particular location is the least enjoyable Red Robin I've ever been to: it's DIRTY and the service is extremely slow and just plain mediocre. The staff needs a lot of motivation and training. However, the restaurant manager called me, asked me about the issues, listened keenly to my feedback, and vowed to make the problems right. As such, I am upping the rating from 2 stars to 3. We had to move tables because the smell was so pungent and nasty - in one of the 2 main sections of the restaurant (the third section is the bar and I kids are allowed) - that we almost lost our appetite. Thereafter it took our server over 15 minutes to come get our order... all this while our 2 year old was desperate to eat. Finally we order our burgers and drinks, and the food tasted very good (kudos to the kitchen), but the fried egg we requested be added to the sandwich was - not unexpectedly - left off. Moreover, we bought a gift card from the bar, and he transaction was done incorrectly. We ended up waiting for an additional 15 minutes to get that corrected after our meal was done and paid for. To her credit, the bartender/server who made the error was very sweet and apologetic. Overall, I would say that as enjoyable as the food is, I would avoid this location and visit some other RR restaurant.

My experience with this location was pretty good. We were waiting for a table and I noticed empty tables so I found the manger and she was very helpful to get us seated as soon as possible letting us know the reason for the wait was because they didn't want to lack customer service. our waitress Alex offered great service and so did Chelsea
nothing to brag about. service sucked as usual. Food is not even worth the money.  id rather go to fiveguys for better burgers
Dirty and disorganized. Had to beg for water that never came plead for napkins and silverware and beer. It went downhill in the last year
Came here with my cousin. He ordered a burger and I ordered a chicken salad. I liked it but my most favorite thing was the root beer float. I ended up ordering a second one ! (Had free refill)

The service was really bad on a Friday night. The endless fries is only for steak fries. You have to pay extra for the sweet potato fries. I've been to another one and they were included.  We had to ask for another server 2x's just to find our server. Each Time we needed something, we waited forever for whatever we asked for. The restaurant wasn't too crowded for a dinner on a Friday night but the service was terrible. I don't think I'll be coming here again. Hopefully all red robins are different.

The special burgers are just good they bring you i with there unlimited fries offer The first Bach of fries that came with the burger were  warm not hot  you get about 10 steak fries very small amount of fries  the people I were with order a second helping took over 10 minutes  the one asked for a third took over 15 a very long wait for fries. Like a said the burgers were good but nothing special we have a large amount of burger place in that area  meat head five guys even a shack shack

The service and food here are fine, but the floor--for whatever reason--is always inexplicably greasy and dangerously slippery. This condition is worse in the men's room. I asked the hostess about the floors and she rolled her eyes and explained, "The air conditioning is broken." I don't get it, either. Also, place always smells a little musty.

Most of the recent reviews are right on point. The women's bathroom does smell like hamburgers, which is most likely because it's right next to the kitchen. Regardless, kind of off-putting. The service was quicker than I expected, though. We got in around noon and were done eating by 12:40.  I ordered the Arctic cod and fries, which is way more than I expected. It was four fish filets and a small amount of steak fries. Very tasty and good tartar sauce. Only negative is that I noticed the paper it was served on was totally soaked with grease, so that made my appetite disappear pretty quick.

I just walk out of this place, we had a party of 10 people (7 adults and 3 kids), and a "manager called Maggie" said they had no tables and waiting list would me more then 20 min with a lot a empty spaces and a Monday night!, very rude and racists actitud for ve a manager, stay away of this place and take you business somewhere else

I usually love Red Robin, but today I'm not happy at all! I walk in and request out favorite server, to be told her area was full( It wasn't according to the server we saw later). We weren't even given a choice to wait. We then get seated in the bar area. And the AC is on, and it's 28 degrees outside. We then noticed someone turned the TV off( husband was watching the game). Now the ("manager") can't find the remote. Didn't even get to the food yet. Fries were cold and had to track someone down to get silverware. Won't be returning.

If I could give this place zero stars I would! The service was good but the food... the mystery chicken was chewy and undercooked. The fries were soggy. Gross! Don't do it to yourself unless you want to get sick the next day!

Unfortunately Red Robin was changed.  We have previously dined here and it was ok. We were seated immediately to a table that had been wiped with a sour bar towel.  The table, seats and menus were also wet. The waitress was very slow and she admitted that she was sick.   We ordered, received our order of cold hamburgers and they forgot to add the avocado.  The salad was not fresh.  The lettuce was brown around the edges and looked like it came out of the bag not washed or cleaned.  As we were sitting waiting to be served my partner noticed something coming down from the ceilings. It was a spider directly above my head.   That will be our last visit.

The food was between okay and good.  My biggest issue was the service, specifically as it relates to the bottomless fries.  I went on a Saturday around 1:30pm.  It was busy but not full.  There were several empty tables in my section.  The serving of fries I got with my burger was very small.  Maybe 8 french fries.  Our waitress didn't come to check on us for about 10 min.  I tried getting her attention but she didn't look over and I didn't want to yell across the bar area.  I was finally able to order more fries but they took close to another 10 minutes.  I tried to eat my burger slowly to wait for the fries but also didn't want it to get cold.  I ended up finishing my burger right when the second round of fries arrived.  I don't understand why it takes so long if they're bottomless.  Shouldn't they be making fries on a regular basis rather than to order?  Bottomless is pointless if it takes 10-15 minutes to get your next order. We then waited to try to get a check.  We finally figured out, when we saw another table use it, that we could pay our bill on our own at this little computer at the table.  That would have been nice to know.  We thought it was just a menu and games so we set it off to the side. There are much better places to get burgers.  The fries may not be bottomless but you get enough that you won't need more.   The one thing I like is that the menu shows what you can substitute, if the sub is extra, and if the sub is bottomless.  I also like the page of the menu that shows ways to make your meal a little healthier. Our waitress was nice but it seemed like she was assigned to the entire bar area.  No one was helping her by refilling drinks, etc.  It seems a manager could go around the entire restaurant refilling fries, drinks, etc.

I have been a patron quite a few times over the years but today was the worst food and service I have had from anywhere  in years.  Four of us came in after attending a movie and it was busy, but not packed.  We ordered nothing unusual, hamburgers, four beverages, two of which were water.  Others were receiving food that cam in following us.  It was an hour before we received out food, which was cold.  We had to ask twice for knives because we were told there weren't any.  In my opinion we should have been had our meal comped, or at least substantially reduced.  It was most dissatisfying.

This is my 2nd visit to this location and I left disappointed by the bad service. It was one big flop of a night! I went to dinner last night with my friend and his 14 month old daughter. Our server took way too long to come to our table and once she finally arrived she left because she forgot something another table had asked for. She eventually came back and we put our drink orders in (1 water, a kid's juice and a beer). Those took forever to come to our table. She brought the water immediately but forgot about the juice and beer. Once our food arrived we had to ask for ketchup and napkins from the guy who brought the food to the table. Our server came by the table once during our meal so it was hard to ask for more fries since she wasn't around. She was nowhere to be seen during our meal. Food overall was good but wish I was able to enjoy more fries!  To add on to the bad service, my biggest disappointment was the lack of a changing table in the men's restroom. My friend tried to go change his daughter but had to come back to the table and ask me to help him. I had no problem doing it but what would have happened if I wasn't there?! As a family friendly restaurant I think it would be a good idea to have one installed for all the dads out there!  I doubt I'll be back but I hope their service improves for future patrons.

Gourmet burgers???? I would have to say not. I had a burger with an egg on it. The cheese over powered everything. It was a unbalanced blane tasteless burger. I would have to say it reminded me of steak and shake.  My husband had a grilled chicken burger which was also tasteless, I would have to take it back at least the chicken was good.  The only good things I would have to say is the service, our waitress was very nice and on point. The chicken tortilla soup was really good and the fries.  The woman's bathroom smelled like grilled meat from the kitchen, not cool.

GROSS! Incredibly rude employees, they had forgotten my order as well as got it completely wrong. I wouldn't waste a dollar on their food, save yourself the trip and time and go anywhere else. McDonalds across the street is a better bet than this place here. I took a small bite of their burger only to be surprised by a medium sized curly hair in my burger!!! Cheap people, couldn't refund me my money or accommodate to my needs. Ive never been so disappointed. DONT GO! SAVE YOURSELF!!!! rude rude rude rude people. No help at all.

The burgers were great, loaded potato soup was not, they charged us $1.99 for the game although we never played.....our waiter was a bit preoccupied. Overall a good experience, the chalk board was awesome as well.

I like coming here because the burgers are pretty good and I always get excited to come here for some reason. I don't know why, but I feel like a little kid again when I come in here. It is a happy environment to be in for some reason because you know you are about to stuff your face with an awesome tasting burger. Honestly, there are many good burger joints out there, but what brings me back here is the bottomless fries and freckled lemonade. The beauty about their lemonade is that you can switch to other flavors, so for the price of one, you can try the others. Also, if you have enough people, definitely get the towering onion rings! I have tried many of the sandwiches here before, but my favorite is the A1 Peppercorn Burger. I substitute the regular fries for the garlic fries, which is 10x better in my opinion. I have never left here feeling unsatisfied! Sign up for the Red Robin Loyalty Card, they give you a free burger after 9, which I get quickly because all my friends help me with it.

This should be my second review of this place. Not sure if I posted the last one. But this place is going to hell. Second time we were served cold breadsticks and lukewarm spinach dip. After talking with a manager the first time you'd think they would keep an eye on it. Last time our waiter explicitly stated that the bread was kept under a heat lamp after being baked in the AM. Gross. Entrees were good. But the service degrades the place and the unfriendly atmosphere is rancid. Fool me once... Fool me twice... Never a third!!

I GOT FOOD POISONING HERE.  DO NOT GO HERE. If I could give zero stars I would.  On Monday of 5/11/15, I had their Bailey's Irish Cream milkshake. And right after, I had a big stomach ache, and then from 1am-3am I was vomiting. And then the next 2 days, I was debilitated with chills, cold sweats, dizziness, and fever.  Do not trust the cleanliness and health of this restaurant.

Been here twice within a week span.  Watching the Hawks play n it was the only place that didn't have a wait to be seated.  Now I know why!   Love a good gourmet burger but this is not the place.  Went with a party of 6 n all got different burgers so we can taste each others.   I always try the basics when trying new places.  So I can taste the actual flavor of the meat without all the other stuff covering it up.  So I got  the plain one...hamburger (no chz) with lettuce tomato onion pickle.  Basic right?  But such a sad burger.  Sadly, none of them were as good as they looked/sounded on the menu.  Not even the one with the egg on it.  And I live a good egg on my burger!!  Buns were soggy. Couldn't really taste the flavor of the meat.  It was all just covered with sauces.  Not how I like my burgers.   Bottomless fries is good I guess but seriously how many baskets can one person eat???   But liked that they offer sweet potato fries.   Onion ring tower was impressive.  Crispy n tasty the first time but the second time we went it was greasy n undercooked.  Certain parts were not cooked n still doughy.  Like they were stuck together when cooking then pulled apart to put on the tower.  Hit or miss I guess. But the Donut tower for dessert was awesome!  Comes with some dipping sauces.  Best part of our meal.   So one star for sweet potato fries n one for the donut tower.  But gonna have to get my burgers elsewhere.

Seven of us came at noon for a birthday lunch. This was better than our last visit, which was pretty good. Many different options ordered, and everyone was pleased. Everything was served properly by a delightful waitress, as were the other employees( especially the gal who brought out a complimentary humongous chocolate ice cream cake that served everyone.)  We never felt rushed, and the staff turn around time from orders to served food was perfect.  My BLTA, bacon, Lettuce, tomatoe, and avocado on a croissant was perfect. Last month at a far more expensive restaurant my Cobb salad had avacado which was blackened beyond acceptable and those folks were not impressed at my comment when the plate was finally removed, with all that avacdo left behind. Avacado is one of the most perishable foods but these folks can handle it.  That gaming and payment gadget on the table still annoys me, but I guess since I do not have to deal with it, it has become a part of the otherwise perfect experience.

Came in Today with my family a party of 5 total. Immediately greeted by a nice young lady. We got seated right away and our server Monica O was at our table right away. She was super friendly, very attentive and got our drink order right away. We ordered 4 burgers and a cob salad. Everything was perfect. I highly recommend this Red Robin. We had such a pleasant time that we had to tell the manager.Blake was also very nice and praised all his staff.I will most definitely come back to this location and I am confident that if I get a different server they will be as polite, efficient and friendly as Monica O!

After my last review, we were generously offered a $20 gift card to return and try again. I'm all about second chances (see my review for Replay of Andersonville for proof!) so we returned! Nope.  1. The heat was on. It was the first 80 degree day of the year and we were melting immediately walking into the place. The poor servers and kitchen workers! 2. Soda watered down to nothing. Our Coke and Dr. Pepper tasted the same.  3. We ordered the "large" buffalo wing appetizer. Firstly, it we the same size as the small $5 version we ordered last time. And, it was clearly sitting for a while, wings were just warm enough to be acceptable and the chips were soaked through (gross).  We left. There wasn't even a point to using the gift card. Live and learn.

Well the burger I paid nearly $14 dollars for...got to say NOT WORTH IT! Not even close. There was a little burger in the ciabatta bun two ultra thin slices of bacon that showed NONE of the peppercorns it was supposed to be crusted in and lettuce was virtually non existent.  I know the steak fries are bottomless but the initial serving was literally about a dozen fries and sitting there next to the $4 approximate value burger I just felt totally ripped off...and to be honest there are SOOOO many good burger restaurants. .Red Robin..I won't be back!

My server, her name was Monica O. and she was polite but she smelled very strongly of weed. I brought my family in from out of town and thought this would be a nice place to bring them and the food was just mediocre. I asked for well done fries and they weren't well done and when I said something to her, she threw a little bit of an attitude. That's horrible customer service. I definitely won't come back to this restaurant.

Service was slow, server forgot my kids' order, drinks were not filled and I had to request for napkins and refills twice.    Red Robin was always a go-to spot for us, but the quality of service has been horrible.  What a disappointment.

It was a good thing we decided to come back here for lunch! The bottomless fries flavored with garlic herb seasoning are definitely worth it and we really liked the Southern charm burger, the chicken teriyaki and my favorite salad-crispy chicken tender salad!

Love this Red Robin!  Just really upset with the fact that today I tried placing an online order & I couldn't log in to check out. Had to reset my password twice & I still couldn't check out. I placed my order at the bar, the manager & bar tender were very nice. But before I left I asked if everything was in the bag, they said yes. Once I got to my destination I took out the burgers & realized there were no utensils, no napkins, no ketchup for my fries, my friends were cold & definitely not crispy. Tried calling the restaurant back & no answer. I love Red Robin burgers & their service at this location just upset with the fact with the way my to go order was handled.

Today was a much better experience, at least food wise. My daughter wanted to go here for lunch after dance, so I agreed. I ordered the wedge salad appetizer and the boneless wings again, but this time with the sauce on the side. Much better! My daughter ordered a patty melt on marble rye, medium, with sweet potato fries, and the burger was cooked perfectly and very tasty. The downside was the dirty table on one side of us, which stayed that way the whole time we were there. The family on the other side of us left and their table remained dirty as well. There were many workers there, including what looked to be a manager walking around, yet no one seemed to notice these tables. This was very unappetizing. Unfortunately our main complaint was the service. Our server was very nice, but very inattentive. He took our order, brought our drinks and food, and we didn't see him again for a long time. He only checked on us once the entire time we were there. We had to look for him for salad dressing, extra napkins, refills on drinks, and worst of all, our check. We had finished eating and sat waiting for the check for a long while so we could leave. Mind you it was late afternoon and he had a few tables, but I couldn't imagine having him serve us at night when it's busier. We saw him a few times but he never made eye contact until I went out of my way to get his attention. Again, not a great Red Robin experience.

So me and the wife decide to have a burger for early dinner. So why not go to Red Robin since they are always hyping there selfs up on there tv ad's. Man did we make a HUGE MISTAKE! First off we went there Sunday around 3:30pm not a busy time, they were busy but not insanely busy. I order a Fiery Ghost burger Medium and my wife a Whiskey River Well Done and I double check with our waitress that mines was Medium and my wife was well done. She comes  back 20mins with a burned Fiery Ghost and a almost raw Whiskey river, and when I brought it her attention she was like oh and just walked away, she came back another 20 mins later and was like my manager took one burger off the tab. Like seriously 1 burger?! We left the burgers there paid what we needed to and walked out. Horrible service and the place was very dirty. Would not recommend.

The worst! Sloooooooow service and incompetent waitress equaled hellish night out. Why offer unlimited fries if one has to wait another 30 minutes just to get 10 more lukewarm fries? I saw a lot of staff busting their humps, so kudos to them and their effort (gets it the 1 star), but I, sadly, did not get one of them as my server. The one bright spot was Ron. He swooped in and saved the day! Management should acknowledge his efforts at keeping a sinking ship afloat! Will never return but will forever be grateful for Ron.

I am updating my review.  the food was good, the bottomless fries are key!  I just had to knock a few stars off for a few things. 1) They have this stupid computer screen at the table to scroll thru the menu.  DO NOT touch anything that says "GAMES" because even if you don't play the game or didn't mean to hit it, you WILL see a $1.99 charge tacked onto your bill.  BEWARE! now our waitress took it off the bill but I am sure so many people let their kids touch it and don't pay attention to the bill 2) um, where is the big Red Robin statue they used to have?  it used to be in the back room by the washroom!  that was a great addition.  why would they remove it? our waitress was great, very nice and helpful just needed to point out a few things!

So this was my first time eating at Red Robin. I came here thinking I would get a good ass bacon burger not the case at all. I order a WELL DONE bacon burger and when it arrives and I bite it pow it's pink PINK!!!! I lost my appetite after that. I tell the waiter/bartender and he fixed it right away but something wasn't right that it came out to quick I hate half and didn't even want it I just wanted to leave. I was better off going to Burger King. The only good thing was my waiter he was cool and didn't even charge me for the burger good looking out bro! I'll never come eat here again

I like Red Robin burgers. I end up always getting the Black and Bleu burger which is a gourmet burger containing sautéed, blackened portobello mushrooms, caramelized onions, house-made Bleu cheese sauce and Bleu cheese crumbles on a toasted ciabatta bun. Delicious and hearty. And unless you're at a Red Robin Express, bottomless fries! (they've caught on with this cheap bastard and only gives out fries DURING the meal, not before). The server was fast and friendly and overall, a nice suburban burger joint to check out, especially if you love fries.

We have a birthday celebration on Saturday the 29th we choose this place Big mistake the food was great but the service its so bad that just ruined our celebration , the waiter was rushing I order a drink and never got it , I even went to the counter to ask for it and dive minutes later the waiter told me that he was on his way , five more minutes he came by the table and said again that he was on his way at that point everybody was done so I said forget about it just get me some water . I was chocking. So to those who provide a service like that I make a point NO TIP FOR YOU!!!

This dining experience was not good.... My previous experiences at this establishment have been OK, but this one was so lousy that I won't be back. Our waitress must've been working through a New Year's Eve hangover because she wasn't cognizant of her job expectations. I know waiting tables is not easy, but still...she brought the food out at room temperature, and late. Items kept falling out of her apron. She'd walk past our table, speak to us about our order, and then continue talking as she walked away. She wasn't rude per se, just odd. Furthermore, for as long as we waited for our cool (as in temperature) food, we still had to ask for forks, napkins, etc. Then, she couldn't figure out our bill and even confused ours with another party's. And she only had 3 tables. We sat, and sat....and sat some more... And then came Ron, and he helped us eventhough he wasn't assigned to our table. We even cash tipped him individually because he was awesome. Thank you, Ron! Our waitress, who looked wasted, even watched him bust his hump as he did her job. What the hell?

Happened to be seated by the kitchen window tonight. I will never return. Out of five cooks in the kitchen, only one wore gloves. Two were eating over the food they were cooking. One continued to wipe his nose and keep cooking. One repeatedly threw fries at other staff. The waitresses were at their service bar eating over the sauces they were dishing up. I watched one waitress cash out a customer who paid cash, clear a table, put her hands on the back of a customer and then went behind the counter and took shredded cheese from the bin WITH HER BARE HAND and sprinkled it on two salad plates. She then served them to customers. The manager was standing beside these people and never said a word. Never again!!! Someone from Red Robin did write and apologized. She sent me a $20 gift card. That wS enough to get me back to the chain again but not the Skokie store.  Three of us ate dinner tonight and two out of three were disappointed. The fried fish was probably slightly frozen when fried, which caused a textural issue and made the coating fall off. The batter was soggy and the liquid from the fish had run into the basket and soaked the fries.  My Banzai dinner salad was written up on the menu as having fresh grilled pineapple, mandarin oranges, almonds, greens, and chicken. The pineapple was canned and fried which was disappointing. The greens included beet greens which have such a strong flavor by themselves and they didn't blend with the other flavors. The salad came with "garlic bread" but it was closer to a large Garlic crouton soaked in butter.  Not my favorite meal.  My daughter ordered the Royal Red Burger and she was delighted. It was cooked as ordered and very tasty.  The service was delightful, friendly, attentive, and most enjoyable. Thank you Travis! Fries are always endless and who doesn't love a good fry?

Kat was the bartender when I came in for my birthday burger; though I was bummed out I couldn't try any new burgers with my free coupon,  super excited for the passionfruit margarita! A perfect blend of tangy and sweet with a royal red robin. She was super attentive, funny,  and made sure I had plenty of fries. Thanks Kat!!!

My uncle and I walked in thinking we wouldn't have a problem getting a table, as there was a whole row or two of opened tables right in front of us....turns out, they're completely understaffed and the only place to eat was the bar (unless we wanted to wait).  So we ate at the bar.   We each ordered (you guessed it) burgers, which took FOREVER to get.  They were alright, along with the fries as well.  Our server was the bartender (I'm pretty sure her name was Kat.)  She was definitely trying her hardest.  She could have used some help, but unfortunately got none.  She is the reason this was not a 1-star review - she tried like holy hell to do as much as she could.  Props to her, but unfortunately that's about the only positive thing I can say about this establishment, as it is clearly very poorly managed.
very impressed...ate at bar, very cool atmosphere...Amanda gave PERFECT service...food was right on, reasonably priced, I'll def be back!

Was my first time at this location. Didn't hear good reviews for this location. But I have to say Amanda made it pleasant. She went above and beyond for me. She checked my pick up order and made sure I got all the sauces and entrée's that I ordered. I was missing the sauces I asked for and she went in the back and got me some. I could have easily just gotten home and not have what I ordered. But she took the extra step and made sure I had everything. That's what you call excellent customer service!

Used to be a fan, but will not return again. Recent renovations closed the rooms up and the atmosphere change is a negative. The burgers got gross.  Dry and unappetizing. The fries tasteless and overcooked. The kids pizza was burnt on one side. How can they serve it like that? The manager got me another burger but I didn't feel like complaining about everything. I just won't come back. Also, they got rid of the helium balloons, and now just blow them up on a stick. This restaurant has really changed for the worse. Lowers to one star.

My go to Red Robin is at the HIP Plaza. Food is always good and service is spot on.  I've come to this location twice and it's awful. Servers are very nice but slow. When I say slow I mean ten minutes before someone takes a drink order and fifteen minutes to get an appetizer out. Tonight when the app came out the pretzels were burnt and the cheese cold. It had rained out earlier in the night and the floors are incredibly slippery. Two people fell down as we waited to be sat. Waited to be sat you say? Why yes, waited a little less than ten minutes despite multiple tables and booths being open.  I just don't get it. Edit: wrote this at the table before the mains came out and can confirm the chicken finger dish was missing a chicken finger; had to ask for it.

Let's just say we didn't even get to eat. My boyfriend and I walked in, we were told there was a 10 min wait which is no problem. The problem is when we are waiting for to be seated and see that two parties of two who walked in after us get seated before us. Better yet, the las party of two had just walked in. When I asked the host why were the other people seated before us she said that the 21+ area was full and the "family" area was freeing up which I think it's a bunch of BS since she wasn't asking anyone's age nor did she asked if we had a preference as of where to be seated; she just took names and called names. A very upsetting situation specially when I'm hungry... Good thing Chili's is right around the corner!

I've been eating at this restaurant for years now with my family but only on occasions. Our waitress this day on December 3, 2015 was Kayla and she was attentive to our needs. I had bacon cheeseburger with bleu cheese cooked well done. My elderly mom had the California grilled chicken sandwich. I also had towering onion rings. The bleu cheese on my bacon cheeseburger and the towering onion rings was my favorite part of the meal. My elderly mom said her California grilled chicken was okay but wasn't too crazy about it.

Haven't gone to a Red Robin in a while so we went with another family for a later dinner (around 9pm). By the time we sat down was still a decent crowd. My buddy ordered the spinach artichoke dip. Always a favorite, right? It would have been good if they gave us enough chips. Seriously it was about a handful of chips. The waiter said he'd come back with more but by the time the chips came the dip had cooled down. Kind of annoyed by that. Strike 1.  We ordered everything at once and by the time we received the appetizer it was pretty empty in the dining room. So we'd probably get our food quickly, right? Wrong!  At other locations during busy times, food would come out in like 10 minutes. It was probably closer to 25 minutes. And we would have asked our waiter but he was nowhere to be found during that time. Strike 2.  Instead of bottomless fries I wanted the broccoli with my French dip meal. Did I get broccoli? Nope. Gave me fries and had to wait for him to bring the broccoli. Strike 3.  Since it took so long to get the food it was practically cold by the time I ate it. Strike 4.  When we asked for a refill of one of the freckled lemonade it basically tasted like water with strawberries in it. Had to ask for another one. Strike 5.  Bad service. Bad service. Bad service. Not sure what more I can say about this place. Definitely not going back to this location.

I love burgers but this spot is ok at best! Gourmet burgers is a pretty large stretch for this place. Came here on a pretty busy Sunday afternoon. The wait for the food was pretty long, I think they were killing the cow in the back. When the food came it was pretty good. I will say I love the sweet potatoe fries with its ketchup  for a $1 more! This place should be a quick spot U  can grab a burger and leave but they make u sit and stay ala some restaurant or sports bar. Overall decent place to come eat and have drinks if u have time to spare as for the burgers just a elaborate steak and shake!

Very upset with how tonight ended. I will not be returning here ever again. And i will definitely spread the word!!! The waitress took forever.  I get its fast food but they dont pay attention to detail. Then a gentleman lost his wallet and noone knew where it went but it was on the table!! So shady!!!!

Myself and a friend were dining here before a movie. We've dined here many a time and never had any issues. There was no problem with our food or our service, however we overheard another server making derogatory remarks. It was clearly meant for someone else, but we had overheard as customers. This "Mickey" was calling a table near us "fat-asses" and "retards". This is the service industry. I had worked as a server in college and I understand that customers get frustrating, but this was a new low. This is especially disappointing because this was not a student. This was a grown man saying things like this. Someone like this should not be allowed to work in a restaurant. It was insulting to hear and we will not be back. Red Robin needs to reassess who they hire or they will soon be out of customers.

I was looking to have a small snack before going to the 7:30movie and decided to go here. I wish I hadn't. I was sitting by the bar, soon after a couple walked in. The man was elderly and disabled. He basically requested a stool to rest his arm on in place of the regular chair that usually is there. Apparently he is accommodated every time he's eaten there. Well , the manager at the time kept belittling him saying NO to him like a disobedient disobedient child. Embarrassing him and making him so upset he was shaking. This was so upsetting to watch I wanted to start telling at her for her horrible treatment not only to a fellow human. But to and old handicapped man!!! Seriously? Who ever hired her should reevaluate her managing style. Bullying is not it. She didn't try to come up with another option. Just kept bullying. As for the staff. They seemed nice enough. But you could tell she makes life pretty miserable. They all were looking like zombies that couldn't wait to get off work. I did walk over and asked if the gentleman was ok? He said he was just going to shake it off. Well. I slept on it and I couldn't. I did ask for her name. Pauline Aguilar.... You should be ashamed. I hope you find some kindness in the future.
Good food. Clean place. Needs some tvs to replace Windows. Great customer service by Molly. Will be back soon to try out the rest of the menu :)
Our waiter Mickey was awesomeeee! Great service. On top of everything with our needs.

Horrible service and food inside a dirty establishment. Went with my wife to give it a shot since we were driving around. Got a table pretty quick with menus. The waitress took our drink order. After the drinks came, we didn't hear from the waitress for 15 minutes. After she walked by for the 4th time, I turned around and called her back. We ordered chips and salsa and the chips were fresh...until we got to the bottom of the basket and they we soggy and raw corn tortillas. They didn't finish cooking them. When the burgers came, they were no better. Everytime the waitress did our drinks, she spilled some on the table. We almost needed a snorkel by the end of the meal. What made it worse was they were not busy and after this experience, I can see why. Never again.

The food is pretty good casual dining food. I just wish the service wasn't so bad. We arrived before 5PM on a Saturday. There was already a 20 minute wait and several families waiting. That in and of itself would not have been a problem, but there were several empty tables around the restaurant. Had they decided to seat people at those tables, they would not have had a waiting list. Very strange. After being seated, the service is slow, slow, slow... Slow to get the drinks, slow to take our order, really slow with getting our food. Our waitress was doing her best, but she was clearly overwhelmed. They must not have appropriate staffing. This place is poorly managed.

As a chain of restaurants, I think it is comparable to a Chili's or a Johnny Rocket's. They have good hamburgers and sandwiches but their perk is bottomless steak fries. I ordered the California Chicken sandwich and really should only have eaten 1/2 of it. It was very tasty and the chicken very tender and I love guac on anything so it was a good choice.  They have their signature Red Robin spice at all the tables and it goes great with their fries.  They have a decent selection of beers and wines and I like how they have a TV on the floor to view while waiting for a table. Service was good and all of them very friendly. It is a great place for kids, too.

I wouldn't even give this place one star! Horrible service....horrible food....dirty bathrooms. My coke was easily the best thing I ordered.  You would be better off going to McDonald's/burger king.  I've been to other Red Robins and they've always been good....except here. Needless to say there management should really take a step back and fix all the obvious problems in this facility. Such a disappointment.

Had a really great experience here with a couple friends. I hadn't been there in a couple years. I had the steak burger with mushrooms and it was amazing. The fries were delish and I loved that the waiter brought out some fries in the beginning with all of their sauces. I'm a sauce girl so that made my day. The waiter was awesome too!!! Super friendly and straightforward. Wish I could remember his name though!!!  I can't wait to go back and enjoy another burger!!!! It was so big I forced myself to finish it.

I've been to this location too many times to count and I always enjoyed the service.  A few times I'd take my God son with me as a treat and out waitress Barbara was so sweet to him and he opened up to her and he is such a shy kid.  I had Barbara as a waitress a few times and she was the BEST!  I haven't seen her the past few times I've gone there.   Ever since they remodeled the location the service has gone way way down!  Horrible service! Last night (Tuesday) 3 of us all over 21 decided to stop in for dinner.  The host tells us 10-15 minutes wait.  No problem for us.  There were 2 families waiting before us.  We sat at the bench and noticed that from the door we could see about 4 empty tables on the family side so we were really confused as to why he had the families waiting.  He got them seated and then took us back to the bar side.  There were at least 7 tables open and no one had walked out while we were waiting.  If all those tables were open why was it necessary to make us wait the 10 minutes.  I really don't understand this logic. We got to our table and I noticed there was only one waitress working on the bar side.  It took a while for her to come to our table, we were actually just about to get up and leave because we had such a bad taste in our mouth about them making us wait for no reason.  We put our order in and had no issues with the waitress she was nice but why was she the only one?  She brought out our silverware which looked disgusting! I had the tavern double and a coke which I enjoyed.

I dont know why, but Red Robin is my spot.  Sometimes.  If i need some greasy food because im feeling down about my day. It'll bring you back up. You walk in and are greeted with a smile and are typically seated quickly depending on how busy it is. Tavern double with the bottomless fries usually seems to be the best deal.  But sometimes ill switch it up and get the fried fish sandwich.  Im not a huge fish but its darn good. The cocktails aint half bad either.  Whatever you need they got it.  Or if you want beer. BAM.   Service is usually spot on.

Dirty table when seated ,waited 10 mins for water ,20mins for our beers ,when food came out there was hair on the plate and the best part the waitress said there was no clean silverware in the restaurant .never again

I love the variety they offer! I'm a vegetarian and Red Robin NEVER gets old!  We had a mishap with one of the meals. We told the waitress and I thought she shrugged it off but not even 45seconds later the manager approached us and apologized. She took the meal off of our bill and asked if we wanted to take a fresh meal home.  The service is #1 and that will always have me coming back!!

When I arrived there, I thought just another burger chain and it was a busy weekend.  I ordered a teriyaki glaze burger with pineapple, to my surprise, the hamburger was pretty good. I enjoyed it very much with unlimited steak fries.  Price was fair for what I ordered.  I had passed up this place so many times thinking over hyped burgers, but it turned out to be one of my favorites now due to this one burger experience.  There are other burgers on the menu that I will want to try.  My companions had burger, chicken and fish, they also enjoyed them.  Although service was good, the waiter looked tired and bored, just going through the motions, and forgot to give me silverware, so I used the plastic pick that came with the burger to pickup pieces of food. I will go back to Red Robin again hopefully this next time I have silverware :).

Unfortunately, as we were leaving I asked myself, "Why is this place in business?" Sorry, the burger was soggy, limp, and tasteless.  Since I don't eat pickles, I asked for no pickles.  I also read they're famous for their pickle relish, so I asked for it on the side so I could apply liberally myself if I wanted.  What I received was a burger with 6 giant slices of pickles inside and a side of salsa.  I lost.  For $3-4 extra dollars, I could've had a decent burger from Three Aces or even Kuma's. Fries were ok. They get two stars for friendly staff.

After long day shift at work (12 hours) to be specific, tired,  I just decided to stop by RR to buy sometime to go and eat at home, I walking to the restaurant and no one was on front  so I continue to the bar and sat, grab the menu and see what's new on the menu but surprise!  menu still the same like for years.. so I just told bartender that I looking for some burger with blue cheese etc. and told her how I liked.. so while  I waiting for the food I guess I spent 25 minutes here the  "beautiful" lady (I try to be sarcastic)  never offer me  at least glass of water, so I grab my food and when I get home I looked and the burger was so detestable It was just a plain  burger, bread and just little blue cheese for almost 15 bucks that I paid for this burger, the money doesn't care but  was so gross I have to add on home all ingredient to make a nice burger and try to enjoy after this bad moment that I got.. services maybe got 2 starts but food 0..

I thought this place was fine, not good but not bad.  I had never been to a Red Robin before (and only just learned about them a few months ago).  It fits into the chain restaurant category well.  It seemed to me to be on the same level as Applebees or TGI Fridays. The staff was friendly.  The manager greeted us at the door, and check on us in the middle of our meal.  The waiter was friendly and efficient, and refilled our water, and steak fries quickly. The food was alright.  I didn't have very much time to decide what to eat (since one friend started to order).  So I skimmed the menu very quickly.  I ordered the chicken ensenada.  I think the chicken was really really good.  However there really wasn't that much food on the "platter".  It is partially my own fault since I ordered 1 chicken breast instead of 2 and did not read the description.  But the platter consisted of the chicken, and a fistful size salad, and 3 kinds of sauces.  If I made this at home I would have had rice, or a vegetable, or something else to take up the other third of the plate.  Sauces should not replace food on my plate. The guys I was with ordered burgers, and they looked okay.  A bit small for $10, but they do come with unlimited fries.  Refills on fries are a terrible idea in my opinion.  But they probably make people happy and cause less waste, so I guess it works.  The fries were kinda bland though.

It was alright. Nothing special, would prefer other burger joints. There was something about the burgers I just couldn't put my finger on. They weren't very satisfying or tasty, and I got their original burger with everything on it, the one they were known for. Their fries are bland and mediocre. We went when it was pretty empty but still, we were given no napkins (we had to ask for them). I don't care too much for the bottomless fries, seems like they give you a small amount so you'd HAVE to ask, and flagging your server down isn't always the easiest. Overpriced burgers. Would not return. I do not understand the hype.
Red Robin is probably one of the best chain burger joints around. 'Nuff said.

So here's the thing about Red Robin, it's okay. The burgers are decent not great, but they are a bit pricey for what your getting. If I'm going to pay $10 for a burger I want to know why, and I've had a better burger for less. Don't get me wrong, this place works in a pinch and is kid friendly which is must for me most of the time. But for two burgers, drinks and a kids pizza the bill was $40, that's just silly. I'm not expecting Kumas, but then it shouldn't cost me as much.

The best chain burger joint. Good burgers, chicken sandwiches and salads. Bottomless fries. Super kid-friendly. A great way to get your week's worth of calories. But they've got a fair number of reasonably healthy options too.

This Red Robin should be burned to the ground. The Red Robin chain itself is an excellent restaurant with a pretty good menu. The bottomless garlic Parmesan fries are Da bomb. But the management here is abysmal.

I was a First time customer and with the experience I had here yesterday,  IT'S MY LAST!!!! I was really looking forward to eating at this place but boy, would I pay for it later. My server was very sweet but the food here SUCKS!  I should've taken it as a sign to RUN, when EVERY utensil at my table was DIRTY. From my fork and knife,  to my appetizer plate, even my cup was disgustingly dirty. I had to ask for everything new.  Well, I FIRST ordered the Pepper Bacon Cheeseburger cause it looked yummy on the menu. However, when I bit into it, the meat had a funny taste to it. So I asked if I could change  my order to a Crispy Chicken Sandwich. Can't go wrong with chicken right....WRONG! It was oily, over cooked and bun was burned. I was hungry so I tried to eat it but I could only eat half. It was so bad! All I can say is before I went in, I was feeling great. When I left not so great.... I was in the bathroom all night throwing up and with the runs. This has been the worst thing that has ever happened to me from eating at a restaurant. And to make matters worse, my total was $57.03! What a COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY. THEY ROBBED ME! Please do not waste your hard earned money at this place. You do not want to get sick either. I NEVER WRITE REVIEWS FOR ANYTHING, BUT MY EXPERIENCE WAS SOOOO HORRIFIC, I REALLY FELT THE NEED TO WARN OTHERS.  It took me a lot to save that money to take my sister out. I feel like they just snatched my money and kicked me in the stomach! Happy Holidays to me, huh! I'm sad, not to mention PHYSICALLY ILL FROM EATING THEIR FOOD. RED ROBIN, YOU HAVE LOST A COSTUMER, NOW GIVE ME MY MONEY BACK $57.03!!!! BACK TO THE TOILET I GO!!!!!....URGHHHHH

Three stars for being open on Easter Sunday and accommodating a request to change the channel to the basketball game, promptly seated & served, didn't want a burger, ordered the Ensenada Chicken platter, boast of having intense baja~style flavor and authentic Mexican seasonings, it escaped this day, fell flat out, while the chicken was moist & tender it was bland and lacked flavor, despite this the service was prompt, friendly and attentive, friend had the angus cheeseburger with bottomless fries, stating they were good and cooked as ordered.

My experience wasn't so terrible I wouldn't return, but it definitely was a mixed bag. I'll forewarn that this probably would be 2.5 or 2.75 if I could, but will go with 2 to balance the 3 star reviews. Will skip writing about the decor, since I'd only write the same as several others. And admit it was my first time going to a Red Robin. Service was alright, but maybe I got lucky by coming here for lunch, compared to some experiences that other reviewers had. (least I'd probably hate to have to wait long for a table at dinner, and would opt for BW3 instead if I had to wait a long time) The server(may also have been a bartender too?) I had was surprisingly nice, and he did explain about the food and other little things well(i.e. bottomless fries, etc.). I liked my burger(one that had onion strings and BBQ sauce in it), but I don't know if I'd necessarily say it was my fav chain burger I've had. I tried my mom's burger(mushroom), and it had a slightly weird taste to it I didn't like. I really wish I knew about the garlic parmesan fries, since their regular fries were too plain for my taste! I will not write off Red Robin yet, due to the fact that the rest of their burger and food menu looked promising. But I do hope that the way the food is prepared is better next time, and am hoping to see some improvement next time here.

If I am going to spend over $10 on a burger, I have my special burger spot that warrants such a charge (kuma's). Not saying that the burger here at RR isn't any good, because the "blackened bayou" one I got was made well - I just have an issue with the completely schizophrenic and bizarre interior. Like a carnival, TGI Fridays, a sports bar and a daycare center all collided together. The wacky colours and patterns and STUFF everywhere was making me nervous and twitchy after about 15 minutes.  But, hey,if you are ADD this might just be nirvana for you.  They do offer take out which might be the way to go in order to alleviate dealing with the inside, seeing as how they are so close by to me. And I will go one step further and say its the best burger you are going to get in a chain. Yes, even better than Culver's. There I said it.

I was craving a burger in the worst way, and decided to try Red Robin.  It wasn't great, it wasn't awful, it just was.  I was more impressed with the appetizers and the bottomless steak fried fries than I was with the burger itself.   I don't know why I was expecting a thicker patty...maybe I built up this place in my mind, maybe my craving in mind also imagined that the burger it was going to get would resemble a Kuma's type burger.  Well, I got a Red Robin Burger..to be exact, I got the Whiskey BBQ burger, with ceddar cheese and I paid extra for some bacon.  You know, it was just ok.  I was looking for that smokey, BBQ burger flavor, and all I tasted was the bun, mayo,veggies and a little bit of the burger.  Like I said, it wasn't bad, and I DID eat it, but I just kept thinking that for the same money, I could have had the burger I really wanted at that OTHER place I mentioned previosly...but let's stay on subject.  I mean, the meat itself could have used some of that famous Red Robin Seasoning they had on all the tables.   We also had some appetizers which I have to say I really really liked, and is what will probably bring me back.  Their onion rings are really good, as are their mushrooms.  Despite what everyone says, not everything that is fried is good...but these babies are!  Nice and crispy, seasoned perfectly.  I also really liked their dipping sauces, and I usually never dip my onion rings..this time, I couldn't get enough of that stuff!! One more thing I noticed, other than milkshakes, they only have like 3 dessert choices??  What's up with that?  I gave up chocolate for lent so that left me with 1 choice.  So we skipped dessert.  hmmmm, not good. Wait time?  Well, we got really lucky, we waited about 10 minutes before we got seated, when we left people were waiting inside and out.  YIKES, I don't think it's worth more that a 15 minute wait.  Sorry, but it's not.  Once we were seated we had no issues whatsoever, our waitress was very nice and attentive. Will I return, yes, probably - I signed up for their rewards program and have a free burger coming on my birthday!  ;-)

Went in today with my friend during her lunch hour and service was impeccable! Our waiter was very friendly and prompt. I had the Whiskey River BBQ burger and it was delicious. My friend really liked the burger she ordered as well. She had made some specifications with her toppings but the food still came to the table relatively quickly. Our waiter knew my friend had to get back to work, so at the end of our meal, he efficiently helped her box her dessert and she was on her way. We were definitely there for under and hour and my friend left with just enough time to spare. She also remarked that the fries were cooked perfectly, and we're both very picky about our French fries. We will be back again!

Not a fan. Went here for the first time for lunch this week and will never be back! Too many screaming kids and not too attentive waitresses!  The burgers have an interesting and not that pleasant seasoning on them, it ruined the whole thing. The way that the burger was done was perfect (I had the blue cheese one), but their special seasoning was throwing everything off. I am glad that I got the sweet potato fries, the regular ones looked awful!  So, with tip for myself it was $17, definitely not worth it for a below average (but well cooked) burger, fries and a coke.

Really. The burgers here are varied and quite good. You get endless fries or veggies or fruit with most burgers.    This location  is clean and well kept up but the seating area outside of the bar area does not give you a feeling of being in a decent restaurant. Feels more like Denny's in the dining room areas.     I would have rated this location higher because the service is very good from the waitresses and bartender but the staff at the front desk is downright rude. Instead of being welcoming to people they act like antagonists. This isn't just one incident nor is  it just our personal opinion. Others were also grumbling at the many times we have visited.     I don't know where their training and manners came from but it wasn't Emily Post or Dear Abbey.     Too bad because the food is decent and the options are many. There are different size burgers and chicken dishes too.     How do the burgers stack up with other places? A little better than some well known burger emporiums but the fall short of the best ones. That said. The prices are reasonable and the bill won't kill you. It's comfortable and really family friendly.     Ask for more fries at anytime. The good waitresses will start you off with some fries. Thick cut steak fries properly done.     They also have  some bottomless drinks like root beer floats.     It is recommended by me if you sit in bar area and can avoid the combat onslaught at the front door. You will like the food.   I added this tag because now they have automated reorder machines on the table where you order from or call the waiter. So much for personal service.  This isn't a drive through fast food place. This makes the service more inattentive than before. With this new feature you do not feel cared for or even wanted. I reduce my rating to two stars.

I've never really had red robin until this moved into the neighborhood, and I must say they have underrated commercial burgers.  I do not know what they do or use different, but the burgers are soft and full of taste.   I recently stopped in on my fat day (Sunday) and was disappointed that the nacho appetizer has been replaced with another style of nachos.  Biggest downside is that you walk out with food coma because the burgers are huge and the fries that come with are bottomless fries (unlimited)

I can honestly say that I have not been to a Red  Robin in a couple of years but we were looking for something fast and red robin was right in front of us. The place was pretty crowded for a Saturday afternoon but they still managed to turn out a mushroom burger, Cobb salad, and chicken on a stick pretty darn quick.  The burger was good. The wife thought the salad was great and the baby had no problem chowing down on the chicken. It's all you can eat fries but the first order was plenty.  The restaurant was clean. There is plenty of parking and the staff was friendly. I wouldn't have a problem stopping into this location again.

I ordered the arctic cod fish and chips.  I just wanted to say that I better stick with the burger options next time because it was just ok.  The service was pleasant but very disorganized.  Our server was working like chicken with the head cut off while the bussers were confused with what table should the food be delivered to.  Apparently, this was a very green team.  Perhaps they just need some experience to get better.

We always liked to go here for a caloric splurge on a decent burger and yummy fries.  Until today.  We went for a late lunch and had to cancel our order and leave after we watched what appeared to be management staff use her bare hands to move individual French fries from one plate under the lights to another.  The simple fact that she wasn't using gloves for this is beyond me.  If it's unlimited fries, who cares if one plate has more?  We pointed out the sanitation issue and advised we had to cancel our order.  She said she would use gloves for our order or remake it fresh.  I just couldn't get past what I saw.  If they do that in front of you, what is happening with the food we don't see? I know it can never be completely sterile, but don't advertise. We won't give up on Red Robin, just this location.

Waited too long to be sitted so we decided to take it to go. However, we had to wait another 30 mins. When i got home i found out that they forgot my dessert. I called them and i also waited like 10 mins. I didn't want to go back so i just told them to pay more attention
Service SUCKED!!! A party of 5 got their food before us (2) and we ordered before them.  I'm NEVER COMING BACK! Food was mediocre

Place isn't bad. Was here again not too long ago for a friend's bday. Even though my friend got his food for free, the total was still over $25 for the two of us. Pricey place and one I normally wouldn't go to unless it was for a special occasion. 3 stars is more on the generous side. It's more like 2.5.

Wanted to try something besides there burgers which was a big mistake! Got the Rib tips with mac & cheese, BLAH!!! Food tasted as if it was sitting on the counter for 5 hours, more bbq sauce and cheese added before hitting the microwave. I'll stick with there burgers.

I came here the other night about 10 minutes prior to close (against my better judgement) and ordered  a tavern double nacho crunch to go. When I got back to the hotel my burger was a soggy burger topped with sliced jalapeño that was cold. I called the manager and he said "they gave you the bus boys burger, can I mail you a coupon?". Unreal.

A little pricey but the combinations of different burgers is really good.  The standout for me the night we went was the dessert chocolate pie.  I hadn't planned on dessert until the table next door got it.  DAMN them!   The fries were tasty but not as good as Five Guys.

Last night I came in with my family and we had a fairly negative experience. Our server, Marissa, I think her name was, was nice but very unattentive unless something was really wrong. Like the fact that my burger (that I asked for medium well) came out medium rare. The new server screen tv deals are a great idea, however if the server doesn't pay attention they don't see the flashing red light EVER, and doesn't care to check back on a table. We had to flag her down several times for refills and silverware and to take our order. Her section didn't even seem that busy and she seemed as though she was more concerned with all the other tables besides ours. The only reason I'm giving two stars was for the manager that tried to make things right. Too bad I had asked for things that never even made it to our table, like a refill on the "bottomless" fries. I have had plenty of great experiences here but this was enough to deter me from coming back. I also had a severely upset stomach from the burger. Thanks.

First time at this location. Best experience so far! Food was delicious and prepared as requested. Service was quick and friendly and perfect timing for occasion. Smiles from the second we walked in. Travis (our server) was amazing! Friendly during entire visit. Noticed we needed refills without having to be asked! He even gave us 2 orders of refilled fries! Super helpful with figuring out the menu. True bottomless fries experience!

Well, the food is decent and the endless fries are great... So not bad if you want a beer and a burger.  What I didn't like ( and this may be the new trend or future) is the tablet on the table... At first I thought it was a neat interesting form of entertainment while your haging out.  Little did I know that they want YOU to do all the work for the waitress... From ordering food, drinks and then pay your check on it... Oh and pay the tip for a waitress that basically doesn't have to do much but show us how to pay and swipe on the thing... And beware... I played one of the trivia games on the tablet and it charged  1.99 on the bill for the app!!! I would't pay it and she had to get the manager to take it of the bill... Technology can be great but when your taking advantage of your customers I don't think it's a good idea... IMO

After several years, we decided to try Red Robin again after seeing a lousy film around the corner. Well, we must have been on a roll because we had an equally lousy meal. The sticky menu did nothing to set a positive tone, nor did the screaming child, but I was still willing to give it a shot. Christopher liked the cole slaw that came with his disappointing burger. I liked the glass my margarita came in. The margarita itself was ok, but nothing special. I had a cup of French onion soup that was tasteless. I also had their riblet appetizer which was awful. I got a side of broccoli with it instead of fries. It was totally unseasoned rabbit food. We will not be back again. The only reason I am giving this place 2 stars rather than 1, is that I am glad there is an alternative for people with kids to go rather than Chuckie Cheese or MacDonald's.

Don't know where to start with this place!! So let's get it out the way I LOVE fries! and the fact that they are bottomless makes it that much better. I hadn't visited this place in almost 2 years and recently came and seen some great changes.  They have all these awesome sauces for the fries that just make your mouth water!! SWEET BABY!!  I really enjoyed the Sweet-chilli and their special Robin home sauce !!  The waiter was extremely nice to bring a sample of all the sauces :) and it was MUCH appreciated!!  I ordered a A1 peppercorn Burger and it was just delish!! Love the bun it's on it was cook to my liking (medium well ) and I can honestly admit that it was possibly the best burger I've had recently!!  I can not wait to come again!!!  Love the decor and atmosphere def a family friendly establishment too!!  Just writing this review made me hungry!! l

Needed to get in and out in 45 minutes! Hostess said it was no problem. That was my first clue! Mentioned the server would be here right of way. 15 minutes later no server. He saw us get up to leave and came running over and said. What's up? I mentioned that because he did not come 15 minutes ago we had to leave not going to be able to make the show. His response was priceless. Whatever dude! yea! Whatever dude! AMAZING!
Really??? Waiting over 45 minutes for a burger on a slow night. This place is not what it used to be. I should have gone anywhere else. If you're hungry don't stop here because you will starve!

My only reason why i gave them 2 stars is bc their lava cake is good. Only reason. Only. Their food quality is so low and most of the time, waiters are so unfriendly. I came here with my niece once. She accidently let go of the balloon and somehow it popped. She wanted a new balloon. Waiter gave us bad look and said if she let go again there will be no more balloon. Or something like that. My niece is two yrs old. Kidding me? U know what im upset again ima make the 2 stars to 1. Btw.. its been 30mins.. Where is my water, where is my utensils? Do I have to remind them to bring me those two basic stuffs? Common now. Lol ima go watch my movie.

This place sucks!  Really poor service.  6 of my coworkers came in for lunch.  Food was poor.  They never refilled the fries.  (So much for bottomless fries). It wasn't clean.  One guy brought his own lunch cause he has major dietary restrictions.  They gave him a lot of crap and didn't let him eat his food. Don't go here unless you are in to unfriendly service and poor food at a high price.

This restaurant is a disappointment. The food was mediocre, but the service wasn't exactly par to Red Robins in other states or towns. I'm also trying to figure out if our server was passive-aggressively racist. My friend and I got out of a movie, and she likes fries so I thought "endless bottom refills" would be great. I typically like Red Robin when tried in other states, but the restaurant chain was new to her. The server only talked to my friend when taking her order. After that, she blatantly only talked to me, or actually waited to talk to my friend when her mouth was completely full as if to make her look dumb or socially awkward. I actually asked, "Would you like to talk to her? She's sitting right there," in a calm, personable voice when the server was asking me about her food before my friend had taken a bite and long before she finally turned to ask.
