The server completely ignored us while nearing the end of everyone else in her section being cleared.  That wasn't the biggest thing noticed, though. I'm Caucasian and my friend is African American. Neither of us drink alcohol, and I wondered if that was the issue. We were sitting in the bar area (faster time for being seated), waiting for service while a table within a foot of us with two Asian American gentlemen who were seated after us got waited on faster and finished first, leaving first, with the same or more food.  At first, the server was almost in our faces every two seconds asking how the food was when we hadn't had a chance to take a bite yet. My friend's food was cold and they got her order wrong twice. The first time, I thought that maybe they tried correcting it, but there were other issues that made her unhappy like the food not being what I should be, and then items that looked like they were leftover from other people's orders. I wasn't sure what was happening, but afterward my friend pointed out that every non-"white" person she served (and yes, there were plenty in the section), she took a long time doing it while the white tables changed out rapidly and received food earlier.  I have friends of every nationality and ethnicity and haven't seen this before moving to Chicago although I've lived around the country. Was the server treating us oddly because my friend is African American or because she was wearing a scarf on her head? No one should ever be treated badly or with less than superior service anywhere they go no matter what they look like, etc. Unacceptable experience.

Absolutely awful !! A complete waste of money. My mushroom swiss cheeseburger was so greasy and slimy that the bun completely fell apart. My son's grilled cheese was dry as a bone-- two giant pieces of stale, toasted bread with a tiny piece of dried out cheese in the center. I told our waitress that the food was virtually inedible. This was met with a blank smile and the priceless suggestion "Want more fries ?"  Um...noooo... The bill for an adult and a child came to about 20 dollars--for food we couldn't eat.  Though we were extremely disappointed ( I am a single parent so we treat ourselves to a sit down restaurant maybe once a month) we at least got a good laugh at the whole fiasco and a new category when we play "Would you rather" Save your money and get a good meal much more reasonably at any number of local restaurants.

very terrible, people working here are very mean to customers and act so busy when they are just working in restaurant's usual business time.  I did not like my food at al and it cost too much money to eat here.  And what happened to good customer service, it is out of the window in this place!!

If you know the Village Crossing area, you know there are several places to go for a light snack & a drink after a movie. We decided to go to Red Robin. The waitress, Bari, was very unpleasant. I wanted to leave the minute I was seated. After she found out that most of us weren't eating meals, she rolled her eyes, walked away with all the menus & threw them down near the kitchen. Her attitude left me with such a bad impression, that I have no intention of returning to this particular Red Robin.

This is conveniently located next to the movies and usually has a shorter line than BWWs. The steak fries were yummy and the burgers were filling and tasty. The bathroom was a disaster- no toilet paper and paper towels all over the wet floor. When we told a worker he seemed like he already knew about it, kind of apologized and blamed it on the female workers.
The burgers were okay and endless fries is pretty awesome but it is pretty pricey to be honest.

Nice server, but SLOW!  We were in RR for over an hour because it took so long for everything. We finished our entire meal before we saw the server again after receiving our meal and the place wasn't even there packed. I timed how long it would take for him to put clothes up my card again after delivering the bill and it was just under 10 min.  The bathrooms were also in very poor shape-out of TO, out of seat cover, and door lock broken!

I am a fan of Red Robin, I really enjoy their burgers... But there is a huge difference from the Schaumburg and Skokie locations.. This location is just OK, their burgers come out sloppy and sometimes the place looks like it needs a good sweep...... I think this Skokie location needs to have a training session with the Schaumburg location because Schaumburg is ON POINT!

Came to get a bite before watching Man of Steel at the movies. Ordered the red robin burger and its the best burger I've ever had. The egg on top adds so much flavor. The fries were so good. Wanted to try the Mac n cheese but our waiter didn't hear me so I will go back. The burger itself filled me up. Will give it 5 stars when I try the Mac n cheese and our waiter gives us napkins with our meal next time.

Id give them 0 stars I could!!!! Went for lunch with my wife and asked to be seated in a booth cause I wanted to watch the tv.This girl who seats you says no and seats us in a little tiny table by the bathroom!!! What a ignorant/$&@(&!!!   We got up and left!! And we won't be going back!!!when a good customer asks you to sit somewhere you let them sit there!! And it smelled there!! Nice customer service!! Went to outback food is much better!!!

Food is expensive for a burger joint!  But I will go because my grandkids love the Mac n cheese.  Food never tastes fresh.  They give you 6 fries and said you can get more "just ask".   Service is beyond bad!   Ordered dessert and the waitress brought the check before she brought Our dessert!   Poor training!!!  Shame on you...
Ordered take out at the bar. The same bartender who handled my cash then stuck an unwrapped straw in my soda....hmmmm... big no no in the food industry.

I am a little bit biased, as red Robin is gluten free friendly. I love their red Robin gourmet cheese burger and order it w salad and freckled lemonade. Their gluten free bun is one of the better ones. The new decor is a little bit too much but this is a, matter of tsar we.
I said medium rare.... I got well done. That kills all the flavor. I won't be coming back her. So greasy. Just damn gross. Get a better chef that actually knows how to cook a burger

Don't go there!. Burgers is Ok.bottomless fries? Yea five processed potatoes in a cup every time. Prices are very expensive for the restaurant level, I felt I got robbed. You put the portable device on the table, for that you lose 2 stars as you attempted to generate more revenue leaving my kids feeling deprived. Red Robbin you are dead to me.

This location has independently decided that bottomless fries are cutting into appetizer sales. We were told by a waiter that they will no longer serve bottomless fries before the meal arrives. We called the manager to the table and reminded him that corporate policy is bottomless fries. I also tweeted at Red Robin and they confirmed that bottomless fries is the policy once you've ordered a food item that includes fries. We love Red Robin but you shouldn't have to jump through hoops every time you want to get fries.
Food was okay. Customer service was great. Had the blue cheese burger. Nice environment though. Like a better version of Hardy's.

I generally like and go to this Red Robin because it was better than the one at the Hip. I like it because they typically seperated the adult couples with the teenages and families. This being said, they need to train their hostess' better.  I went there last week at around 7pm during a weekday. They had a few but not alot of customers. There was no one standing in line. I don't think this is their closing time. The hostess greeted my wife and I, and sat us next to 4 teenage girls and walked away. The family section was open with a few groups. Plenty of space everywhere. I am guessing the adult section was full and this why we were placed in the family section. I asked to be reseated so she sat us next to the changing/dish station. Was this out of spite? I asked to be reseated again. She gave me this attitude like "just sit, I've got things to get done."  Restaurants need to understand that we dont care which server is next in line for customers. We dont care that you are trying to close a section for the night. 7pm is not late. The cleaning/ dish station, the seat by the kitchen door, next to spoiled brats, and by the restrooms are the last locations an adult couple would like to be seated. So unless the place is packed, don't sit us there. The preference is not yours, but should be the customers. If there are seats open, please seat us in the booth on the big wall. The food and server were good but the attitude of the hostess spoiled everything. Managers pay attention; The attitude of your hostess is making me rethink the next time I go there.

This isn't normally my type of joint but we had a short period of time before catching a movie so we made do. Surprisingly, they have a delicious "Wolverine" burger that I would totally come back for. Our waiter, Mike, was also pretty awesome.

Indeed, I occasionally go to chains.  And when I go to chains, I review them against other chains, as opposed to reviewing them against neighborhood joints. As far as chains go, Red Robin is on the lower end of places I enjoy.  Of course, it might have helped if I had ordered a burger or if my fries had been hot.  Or if we hadn't been sitting immediately under an air conditioning vent.  Those things made it a far less pleasant dining experience. That said - my chicken wrap was decent, the boyfriend enjoyed his burger (and the bottomless fries - his second batch of which were right out of the oven and much better than the ones that came with our meals), the free refills on the soda were MUCH appreciated and the servers could not have been more attentive.   I might not rush back, but I wouldn't be surprised to find myself here again in the near future.  And next time, I think I'll just have a burger.
Burgers were scarce fries were cold onion rings were chintzy no wonder it was all you could eat fries nobody wanted them

My wife and I used to love this place. We have not been here for a while and what a disappointment. Since we sat down nobody could figure out who's table it was where we were sitting. After 10 minutes a waitress showed up and took our order. She apologized for the delay and explained that there was a misunderstanding. Brought our drink and then the wait. The wait. The wait.  I saw our burgers sitting in the window for at least 10 minutes. No food runner. No food runner. No food runner. Finally we got our food and what a disappointment. Burgers sucked so bad I really think it was worse then any worse place ever. And fries were cold. Never going back.

So I'm Yelping a chain restaurant. Deal with it.  I had never been to a Red Robin. I saw a lot of commercials for Red Robin. Those commercials made me want to eat at Red Robin. My husband and I cannot say the words "Red Robin" without adding "YUUUUUM" at the end.   This past week we went to see a movie at Crown and decided to hit up Red Robin beforehand. After all that marketing, I was pretty pumped about going. I went online ahead of time and picked out my order. I spent my day dreaming of a juicy burger with thick slices of bacon and a fried egg.  Dude. Red Robin is overrated than a mo-fo. Talk about a letdown.  The hostess was efficient. The waiter friendly. There weren't kids running around screaming like I had feared. But... the burgers were disappointing. The thick cut bacon that they spoke of on the menu was weak. The egg was overcooked. I'm a glutton and I was hoping it would be a little bit bigger for $10 but I suppose I don't need that much artery clogging goodness. I guess it was all just... ok. I can think of at least 10 small places in the city with better burgers for less so I highly doubt we'll be back.  Once again... I have been tricked by a commercial. Bastards.
Good place to go. Burger was good and the bottomless fries were awesome. Nope cant eat more than two baskets. The fries are filling :)

This place has sadly gone down hill. The renivations they've made have removed the fun, open, happy vibe this place used to have. The taking out of the arcade game also very much disapointed my son who had been looking forward to it all day. The service has slowed to a snails pace with things being brough out in random order. One appitizer brought out before simple drinks. Meals being brought out before the other 2 appiztizers, having to flag someone down for refills, servers you had to ask multiple times for simple things. I'm a reasonable person if the place had been packed I'd of over looked this and said well there busy but they weren't. Our side of the restaurant was practically empty. Only a few other tables. Now granted I couldn't see the other side but it didn't seem like they were swamped by any means. But now lets get to the thing that coujld have turned it around the food. Sad to say it didn't. The food like the service and the atmosphere has gone down hill. Maybe the kitchen was just having a bad night I don't know. My chili had no flaver and was like meat with water in it, my husbands soup  was watery, and our burgers were just greezy and disgusting no flaver and just weren't appealing at all. The fries were not so great either.  Honestly if I was at a fast food place I'd probably be less picky but Red Robin used to have really great burgers so we expect better. My son did like there Pizza but beyond that it was just a very disapointing meal. We'll have to think long and hard before going back.

I liked my burger and a large selection of non-alcoholic cocktails.   I did not like the slow service and the confusion with my order. My husband ordered the fish in chips and said it was not very tasty.   In general, I can not say that this is a bad place and I do not recommend going there, but we do not like it. :(
It still is a bit off, but it has gotten much better !

One of my favorite burger places to eat at.  I have never had one bad experience here.  The service is great and the food is awesome. I've had many things of the menu, but my favorite is their Guacamole Burger and Garlic Fries.  The Wings are not bad, but if I want some wings, I'll go next door to Buffalo Wile Wings. When I need to eat healthy, I have a Turkey Burger.  The meat is still pretty good.  The prices are not bad at all.  I enjoy the burgers so much, I lick my fingers afterwards.   The only thing I don't like about this place is that they got rid of several of my favorite burgers, including the Santa Fe.  Sigh.  Bring it back please? Other than that, no complaints.

Love coming to this location before a movie, the staff is nice and inform of the food they sell. The onion rings, zuchini, jalapeno pepers are great and then the burgers are awewsome, I try to get a new one when I'm here. Staff does not overcharge here and know the prize for kids meals unlike the staff at the new location in Norridge. A good time to go on a friday would be around 6 to avoid the traffic.

I love the food but wish it was served warmer. Speaking of warm, it was freezing in restaurant. I wasn't the only one who thought so, other customers were wearing their coats too. I asked the manager to turn the heat up which never happens. We had to eat our food super fast just to get out of the cold.

I really didn't enjoy this.  I had the original cheeseburger and it was just okay.  Very weird being asked if I wanted my burger "with a little pink or no pink".  Not sure what is suppose to be so special about their fries, I've had lots better.  Then after the meal, when I asked for a cup of coffee, I was served an ice cold cup of coffee.  Took ages to get the waitress to tell her the coffee was cold, then had to wait for 15 minutes for them to make new coffee.   All in all, it's not someplace either me or my boyfriend will be going back to.  Just not worth it.

If you're expecting to go celebrate a birthday at this RR beware! They won't sing a song for your family members even if you ask 5 different people (including a manager).  I've always been a loyal RR customer...Not sure we'll come back after tonight. The manager was stand offish when I stood before him in tears on our way out. His only compensation for us was "sorry I told your waiter your table had bdays. I'll have a word with him" That's it? How does that make up for the fact that we came for a birthday celebration (because RR does fun Birthday celebrations, or so we thought) and they refused to give one to our family??!!!  UGh

Freaking delicious. I had the fish sandwich.. omg, so crispy and it was actually reaaallll fish. Wa-hey, who knew?!  The fries were good, the coke was a bit too watered down. But the place was lvely and entertaining and really felt like a classic burger joint. Enjoyed it.

wait is always super long, SUPER LONG!! people with the same sized party come in & get seated before you do. server is slow, hardly comes to the table. the food takes FOREVER to come out & when it is it's only hot sometimes.. prices are high for a lower quality. overall can't give it a great review. they also got rid of the cookie ice cream thing that I loved. lame. they do have one great server, Josh! super nice always helpful does his best to accommodate everyone. he's great. everyone else sucks.

I like this place. Chain restaurant or not, I love their burgers and the fact that they have a veggie and vegan patty substitutes. Their bottomless fries is both a blessing and a curse. I just need to rely on willpower to stop eating them. I come here about once a month or so, and service is generally pretty solid. I've never had to wait too long for a table either. I also enjoy how you can have single orders of the appetizers now.

Thanks from a proud Air force veteran for the great lunch you served today. I have been to your restaurant many times and always enjoy the food and service. That double tavern with fries tasted twice as nice today because you fine folks picked up the tab. Thanks for the meal and the great service. I will be back again and again Thanks

Blah.....  For a gourmet hamburger spot they really suck. The only reason they get two stars is because the waitress thought my younger sister in law was my mom. The food is overly salted and my medium burger was well done. You would think if your specialty is burgers you would know the difference between medium and burnt is.
This place is okay. I only had their chicken sandwich..not too fond of the fries. Maybe I'll try a burger next time.

The royal burger is just awesome, nice location, nice restaurant and friendly employees. I've also been to the one in the Independence, OH area and both of my experiences were great. I'm very happy that Red Robin came to Skokie! Nice environment for young kids and teen agers looking for a burger place to enjoy a date.

I love Red Robin.  This might be my favorite burger restaurant. The reason I only gave this four stars is the atmosphere.  This place is for kids.  There are kids here.  The wait staff are not very personable, probably from having to deal with so many screaming kids all day.   That aside, the burgers are AMAZING. My favorite is the Banzai Burger, but I also enjoy the Whiskey River Burger.   Another con is there are no drink specials.

This Red Robin is great. Ive been here about ehhh 10 times. The service is great. They always check on you every so often. Their burgers are TO-DIE-FOR. I always get the Whiskey River BBQ Burger. Its just amazing. It comes with endless fries, so go there hungry. Ive had one milkshake and it was good. Not great, but not bad. Sometimes there are kids running around, but hey, what do you expect when there's a B-dubs right next to it.  Overall, their burgers and service are amazing!! I look forward going there, always.

Never having been in a RR before, I was pleasantly suprised! For once, I just had a diet pop with my burger.  After the shock of just having a diet pop wore off, I could enjoy my burger. Foog was pretty good.  Better then I expected.  For me this would be only a lunchtime place.  But a pretty good one at that

I've loved Red Robin since I started going when I lived in Houston. I hate that it's so far from the city! I will say, though, that it is in a pretty good location because it is in the middle of a shopping strip. Food was delicious as always. I'd come back here if I was in the area.

This place has gone downhill in the past few months. Very odd for a chain. The service went from friendly and quick to grumpy and painfully slow. My family had frequented this location and thought maybe it was a temporary fluke. But it has persisted for months. Sad, really, because we loved eating here.

I actually kinda like this place. The food is pretty consistent, and the fries are good and plentiful. My hubby likes their fish platter and their chicken sandwich. I normally get their burgers and chicken sandwich as well. In never leave there hungry. This is my go-to place for a decent burger and good thick cut bottomless fries.

I tried RR this weekend for lunch for the first time and this place has some of the friendliest service I've ever experienced. I was with my 9 year old cousin and needed something that was kid-friendly; boy were they ever. Kids menu with crayons and puzzles, pictures of the food to help them order and $3.99 for parmesan noodles, a side AND bottomless chocolate milk? Holy cow!  I got their mac n cheese which comes with some kind of garlic bread and a side salad. The salad was good for a chain resturant and the mac n cheese was delish. It was ALMOST too cheesy, so I would probably only get it if I was very hungry. They also have the option to substitute a veggie or vegan patty for any burger. Nice! I love veggie firendly places!  Our waitress was extremely friendly, and the owner was checking tables to make sure everyone was enjoying their meal. When I was charged for spaghetti instead of the parm noodles (only 60 cents difference) they not only gave me a free appetizer coupon but took it completely off the bill!  I'll definitely be back to Red Robin... especially now that I know they have a bar. ;)

My husband and I decided to venture into Red Robins one Saturday afternoon just to check it out. It was our first time there and we had no idea what to expect.  First off, we thought it be sort of like McDonalds or Burger King when you just place your order, get it and jet. We were pleasantly surprise that it was a sit down joint.  My husband and I got a little nervous because we had a McDonald type budget  so we didn't know what to expect price wise. We asked to sit in a booth, the waitress was nice but she stationed us right by where the waiters go in and out to serve. Note, there was a bunch of empty booths in more desirable areas. But, I concurred, I was starving and just wanted to order! I sucked it up and told my hubby that their food better be worth it!  To make a long story short, Red Robins food was very yummy! I especially love their Strawberry lemonade drink (Mmmmmmm!) I don't remember exactly what I got from them but I do know it was one of the cheaper burgers on the list LOL! My husband and I were both satisfied and agreed to come once again!

A far too salty A1 Peppercorn burger with bottomless steak fries for 10 dollars. I ate about half the burger, 3 fries (pieces, not refills), and guzzled so much iced tea... the salt!!! When we got our check, I thought "For 5 extra dollars, we could have had dinner at Kuma's!" This place is pretty much the same as TGI-McFunsterbees, but with a menu dominated by burgers. It is far too bright in here and there was a gross dude spitting in the parking lot. Yuck. Friendly host and server though. Unfortunately, I won't be seeing them again. Ever.
Staff inattentive, food mediocre, overrated.  Won't be coming back in near future!!

We went here for a quick celebratory dinner.  It was quick, which was nice.  It was very awkward for me when the waitress brought us two alcoholic drinks and we had only ordered one.  We ended up keeping the other and not getting charged for it because they couldn't serve it to anyone else.  It was still awkward for me though.  Then, I ordered the turkey burger.  What came out appeared to be a kid's hamburger, which kept up things being awkward.  I eventually got my turkey burger, which was very good and hit the spot.  The high top tables in the bar area are too close together and the chairs are an awkward height when sitting at the table.  This would get more stars from me if they could fix the accuracy of the service.  Our waitress was very nice, but the inaccuracy was distracting.
Red Robin has one of my favorite burgers and I love the sweet potato fries. The service at this location is very good as well.

If your ever stuck in the suburbs looking for a decent place to eat, this is a good option. Great, fast service seems to be a common practice around here makes it an easy pick. Plus, great for kids. Kids are greeted at the door with a balloon of their choice and a fun vibrant environment. Fries are super good here, and even better, they are bottomless.  Menu is extensive, esp the burgers which they pride themselves on. Not the best quality though - just a bit better than a fast food burger - but def more expensive.  Still, lots of variety and some sandwiches, like their grilled chicken sandwich with pesto, is tasty. They also offer other healthier options like their turkey burger, natural burger, and garden burger.  Haven't tried yet but i do appreciate the choice. Apps are decent. My wife particularly enjoys the onion rings that come on a big cone with a variety of dipping sauces.  I'd def come back given the great service and how much my 3 year old son loved it. And don't forget the bottomless fries!

Food was bad, service equally bad. Went there with my 5 year old, so I know this place caters to kids and not top notch service, but pleeeease.  I Had to ask for utensils and napkins after food was brought out. Server never stopped by again until he brought us the bill. Then he asked how everything was. Didn't offer drink refills. I had the $9.95.California Chicken sandwich. Bread was a hockey puck, guacamole was literally a smear. Not worth the price.  I've been to the red Robbin in Lincolnshire and Algonquin. Those were fine.

I love Red Robin -- one of my favorite burgers to be sure, and it's always consistent.  I like this location for its proximity to the City; others in the Chicagoland area are definitely less convenient.  The Whiskey River Chicken Burger, Bonzai Burger and bottomless fries are all great.   They will bring you any sauce/dressing you want for your fries, and I recommend that you order them extra crispy.  It's not as much of  pain in the ass for the servers as it sounds, as they have a button on the ordering panel for discerning gorgers like me. ;) Sign up on   for your free birthday burger.

came here with a group of cousins, because that's how we roll.  This is an advantage, as everyone orders different things, and there you have a buffet of things to try, all the time.... Had the spinach dip appetizer and it was decent. Not the best, but okay for Red Robin.  I will have to try their many others one ordered fish and chips.  Very tasty, fish done british style, as it was lightly battered.  Chips or, in America, as we say fries, are steak fries, with a slighty crispy outside, and soft inside.  You must have them doused with malt vinegar.  There is no other way to have them at this place.  ketchup is overrated.   The drinks are very good, although I didn't get to have a milkshake. Most of the ladies ordered the strawberry lemonade.  Perfect harmony of strawberries and lemonade without being too tart, or too sweet.  That is a horrible combination (puckered up) Must go back for their burgers.  Oh by the way, they have unlimited amout of fries!  Eat up
I am not compelled to say Yuuummmm! as their commercial indicates would be my initial reaction.  Plus, $10.00 for a burger and basket of dehydrated fries?  No sir, I don't like it.

I had to look  to the Yelp stars for guidance on this one. I really was stuck between had better and A-OK. Because I've had better, however this was A-OK. Say what? Well I'll give this a go: Greeting- Fast and friendly, however the hostess tried to seat at at the worst table, the one right up in front to the left, the one that is right next to the hostess station and everyone coming/going. Many other tables available, this is just a pet peeve of mine. Waiter- A quick hello, then it was a hello where did that guy go, we need to order. I was out with a friend on a lunch hour. Ordering- Damn, I can't get my burger medium RARE, the waiter says can get some pink, I deliberate while friend orders. Well okay I guess, I'll try it, since I've been trying to limit eating out and I really want a burger. Food- Not bad, some pink. Meh, what can you do it's their policy and they did tell me upfront, so I can't blame them there, not like other places that say okay medium rare and comeback with something that looks like a lump of coal between the bun. Ah the bun, it fell apart nothing like ketchup getting underneath your finger nails, it was a mess. They must be buying the buns from the same place that the Sox are getting theirs from. Waiter redemption- When he checked back with us and wanted to see if we needed anything else, we explained the time crunch. He delivered the check stat and brought back my credit card right away. Cost- Yes, I usually don't charge lunch, I think this place is a bit, just a bit pricey. I could see this adding up real quick for a family. Overall probably won't seek this place out, but if in the area and hungry well okay. It's a chain, and I generally don't like places like this, but that's certainly not their  fault. If I used that as a decision then we'd be at one star and I don't think that would be fair. This just left me with a growing appreciation for Miller's Pub, great burgers done just the way I like them, they're not a chain which I love and they don't hand you a balloon when you walk in. Hell I'm in my 40's with no child in tow, a balloon?  Go here if you like TGIF, Olive Garden, Ruby Tuesdays...you get the idea.

Don't really like big business restaurants, I'm more of a small "mom & pops" place myself....  But this place is convenient after watching a movie at the theater around the corner....  Burgers are good, chicken is kinda dry for my taste, but their garlic fries are what I come back for....& their refreshing freckled lemonade.....

Decided to give it a try after driving by so many times. I had the royal burger which comes.with bacon and an egg, as well as.lettuce, tomato and mayo; it came to the table looking a little sloppy but it was great! Had the steamed broccoli side dish, which is awesome for me, as I don't eat fries that often. I did have to ask for a place setting, but other than that the service was good. I would go back.

This was my second visit to a Red Robin Restaurant, but my first to this location. My first experience was out of town and pleasurable. My experience at the Skokie location was less than favorable. Myself and six friends met early on a Saturday evening. We were quickly escorted to a large booth near the center of the main dining room. After a significant wait to place our orders, a new waitress appeared explaining that our designated waitress was hung up on something. She was actually at the table next to us chatting with a lone patron for over 15-minutes.  We waited 40-minutes for our orders in a not so busy restaurant. I ordered chicken fajitas and they arrived luke warm. Our meal was interupted four times by waitstaff loudly clapping and singing a happy birthday at various tables. Kermudgeon I'm not--this was overkill. The restaurant is extremely loud with no soft surfaces to absorb noise. It's difficult to carry a conversation, even at close range.  The restaurant is located in Village Crossing Shopping Center, adjacent to Buffalo Wild Wings and Kerasotes Theaters.  Perhaps this was an off night, but it will be a very long time before I consider coming back. Enter at your own risk.

First of all- Milkshake= Delicious.  You can split one with someone for the perfect amount.  Otherwise theyr'e huge, and too expensive. We got the chocolate (I usually don't like chocolate) but my mom wanted it so I said fine.... I REALLY LIKED IT.  It was creamy and delicious and the whipped cream was soooo good. I also got the Banzai burger, without the pineapple, which was ok.  It wasn't great... also the fries were just ok.  But overall I was happy with the experience, it was kind of what I expected.

I love me a burger. Even a bad burger can usually satisfy me with out complaint. I was very pleased to find out that a Red Robin was now open so close to us! It actually just opened 1/19/2009. It is very obvious that they are still working out many kinks here. It was not bad enough that I will not be back but I think i will wait a little while before I return, after they have everything down. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. The staff did an excellent job of making us feel welcome. Our server did a good job too. There was a little mix up with our order but they were able to fix it. My burger was kind of luke warm and my fries were not good at all. They were VERY oily and also luke warm. They were not unbearable and I was very hungry so I ate them without complaining.  I am sure that once everyone here gets things down, I am sure they will be fantastic. I will be back in probably another month once they have all of the kinks worked out. I am looking forward to updating my review!

I normally don't write reviews but my experience this time was so horrible I felt like I should voice my frustration. We went in at around 8:40pm and the hostess sat us at the booth right behind her station. We waited 15 minutes before getting up and leaving. Not only was the seat wet, no one even gave us water or even acknowledged us even as multiple waiters walked by.  One waitress even served a booth next to us but ignored us completely.  The hostess didn't even seem to really care that we were leaving after being sat down and all she said was, "bye"

Worse service EVER!!!!  The manager claimed that they were under staffed.  Um, maybe you should hire more people?  The few servers that you have might not forget to bring out condiments or fries. They even mess up orders that are written down. With all of the other burger joints popping up all over the place you guys are on borrowed time. I think the majority of reviewers agree

Still too new.  Bdubs was crazy packed so, thought I could stop in for a quick bite. Since the dining was filled with families, opted for the bar.  Staff is still too new. But, some similarities to other Red Robin locations. Like for instance, they offer all kinds of red, sparkly, teas, sodas, etc. I haven't been to a location yet that has a waiter/waitress that's remembered the exact drink I had and refilled the same drink. Just look at the previous table ticket and refill the same drink? maybe.  Every time it's refilled not with a tea but one of the soda mixed drinks.   Had a mango margarita which tasted virgin.  Never again.  I'm sure most would agree with me, chain locations never add enough alcohol.  They use strict measuring and the drinks never taste like alcoholic beverages. Sitting in the bar, everything lacked.  No flatware, napkins or condiments.  WTF? right.  Had a waitress that just wasn't paying enough attention or maybe she was overwhelmed? Red Robins burgers are usually around $10.  The alternative burgers are cheaper, like.. Garden, veggie, turkey or fish.  You still get free refills on fries and non-alcoholic beverages.

I thought this would be a cool place to try before a movie.  The decor IS really strange.  It reminds me of Chili's, TGI Friday's and Steak and Shake all rolled into one - if that makes any sense?  Prolly not.  Anyway...the food: My mushroom burger was delicious.  It really was.  I can't complain.  It was big, well done, greasy and dripping with garlic mushrooms. Yum.  My fries were also really good.  They use those big fry wedges.  I liked 'em.  Now my milkshake...was phenomenal!  I ordered the peach shake and it was outstandingly good.  A gentle, real peach flavor in a shake so thick I could barely get it through my straw.   Overall, the food was good, decor is strange, and service was "meh" - i.e. just ok.  I'd come back here but Red Robin is really not a destination place but the kind of joint you might stop off at before a movie.

I brought my 4 year old daughter here for a "date night". Decorations were kinda dorky, like the Statue Of Liberty up front holding a  burger & the TV mounted flush to the floor. Burgers are FANTASTIC!  I'm not a fan or relish on a burger, but it really works on a Red Robin burger.   Nice place to go for a decent, casual dining experience.

Gross, gross and more gross.  The appetizer - Cheeseburger Queso or something like that was some stale velvetta with ground beef nibblettes that had more grease then actual meat.  When we let it sit for a bit all the grease rose to the top of the bowl! Nasty!!!  After seeing the grease in that I decided against a burger, and opted for mac & cheese with a side salad. the mac wasnt hot, and the cheese was still in its shredded state on the top.  I think the pasta gets shipped in with butter on it because there was an odd white-ish non-cheese substance on my noodles. My friend that got the burger was sorely disatisfied too.  The company in the restaurant was somewhat confusing, screaming children mixed with an old-timer hick dive-bar crowd.... I felt bad for the waitress - Amanda - because she knew the food she was serving was crap. She was super nice & was over at our table with refills & to make small talk a few times. Amanda is the reason this place gets any stars.

I'm so glad they are finally open!  Yay! That said, like all other, sit down restaurants in this area, the wait is not fun.  Then there's the fact that most of the restaurant was in line with the door, so when people were coming in and out, you had the potential... even as far away as we were from the door (by the bathrooms) to be cold.  That sucked. The hostess struggled with the reality that the first few tables they selected for us, after we'd waited for 30 minutes for a table and they'd already called us, wouldn't work with a sling for the infant carrier we had with us.  Eventually they got that working, but I've knocked two stars off for the wait and the lack of tables to work with an infant carrier. Food, hey, it's Red Robin, the burgers rock!  This is the only chain restaurant that I've ever been too that has consistently great burgers!  We did try the Cheeseburger con Queso, and that, I must say, was not impressive... it tasted just like the Con Queso dip at Chili's which I also find unimpressive. That said, we will likely go back because we are just stoked that we don't have to drive all the way to Woodfield just to good to Red Robin now and the food is good... just need to find a time when the wait isn't so bad. And can someone please tell me why the restaurants at Village Crossing are always busy?
I'm an adult who loves their kid's mac and cheese. Sometimes I have to fight them for it, but I always win. Not to mention the fries are fantastic.

I'm don't normally eat burgers but when I do I like to shop out the best places.  I had the bacon cheddar cheese burger with sweet potatoes fries.  Yummy it was the best burgers so now I can't wait until I have another craving.  This was my second visit to Red Robin the first time I had a grilled chicken sandwich also very good and fries excellent.  The service was great also.

Love the burgers!  Got rid of my burger....5 alarm burger (I think).  Bit pricey though...but unlimited fries though...ask for some chipoltle sauce though....gotta get that as well as the awesome drinks....That one drink with the strawberries in it is amazing.  I believe it is mixed with lemonade...I always get mine with crystal light.  Also...unlimited refills on the drinks!

For my first time being here, i had a good experience.  The waiter was attentive and the burger was fat and juicy.  It was also great for the next day.  I normally am not big on fries, however I finished all of my fries here which have great seasoning.  Next time I will try one of the shakes which I wanted to have first but ended up being full.

Our first experience at this Red Robin was AWESOME. (Our server was a younger high school aged kid who was SO on top of taking care of us and he even stopped to chat a couple times and we tipped him real well for the experience, as well as his good recommendations on the burgers. The bayou burger and bonsai burgers are the best there I've had so far. The mushroom and swiss burger is loaded with mushrooms but that's about all that's memorable about it...Mush and Swiss I got the second time around by the way...) So then a couple days ago we were back, we had a waitress this time who hardly checked in on us, gave us 2 napkins after we were practically done eating, did not bring us fries outside of what came with our burger and did not let us know that they WERE bottomless fries. However, she did re-fill my strawberry lemonades (so good) as I finished them and got us our check in a timely manner. What else was kind of a slap in the face was that it wasn't busy at all. I've worked in the restaraunt buisness and I've seen better service even on busy nights...anyways. There was no real awesome customer service and had we had this experience the first time we went I can almost assure you that we wouldn't be interested in coming back :(.  If you go though, the garlic fries are worth the extra 50 cents.

I'm very very very happy this RR opened!  I love Re Robin Burgers, they make me happy! =)   I'll give them a break, because it's their first week.  The first time I went in, I didn't get service for about 15 minutes... that is a loooooong time.  I cut her slack.  The food was good but they haven't perfected the smiling burger just yet.  It was a bit sloppy.  I went in a second time.  The server was very nice and fast. Loved that.  The burger still yummy!  Banzai is my favorite... onion rings are good.  And the fish burger is my second.  Yum yum.  I love the atmosphere there.  Oh... and freckled lemonade!

This place is pretty good if you have kids.  Burgers are ok and there is a good assortment.  Service can be slow when busy and I was surprised how long the wait was at 5:30 on a Saturday evening.  They promote the "bottomless" fries, but that just means that they give you hardly any and make you ask for more--which can take forever if they are crowded.  On the plus side, they have cheap beer specials that make a beer just a few cents more than soda.

I love Red Robin!  The food is always consistently good here.  The problem with the Skokie Red Robin is this--I've been here four times, but I've only eaten here twice. This is because I've been seated by a hostess, only to be ignored for 30+ minutes and had to walk out.  I think most burgers in Chicago suck, so I always want to go here, but it is usually a bad idea.
20 checkins and no review? Gosh time flies. Red robin is Yummmmm.   Every single time.

It was only a ten minutes wait on to get a table. Once seated, our server at our table pretty quick for drinks.  We ordered the  Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger & All-American Patty Melt, with unlimited fries.  Both were superbbb.  Each dish was reasonably priced at about $9. When we're around here again, I'll definitely consider Red Robin.
Just stopped in for drinks. Good drink selection for all ages. Even a bottomless root beer float is available. Enjoyed for drinks, not so much for food though.

Let me begin by saying that I was so excited when I learned this Red Robin was opening.  It's a nice change of pace from all the usual in my neighborhood. With that said... this location has only been open a few months and you can tell.  The food is good (well, at least, the burgers and fries since that's all I've tried), but the service still needs to improve.  I haven't necessarily received bad service; however, I wouldn't rate it highly either.  The first time I went the server was really good (and cute too), but it took a while to get our bill at the end.  The second time our server just had her own personality (maybe one that doesn't necessarily click with mine).  I felt rushed even though it took a while to get our order.  Plus, my shake was milky (aka runny aka watery)... and that's a big no-no for me.  Shakes MUST be THICK!  Otherwise, I would order chocolate milk! Anyhow, I definitely plan on going back.  I'm just hoping they work out a few kinks by then and that service gets a little better.  Oh... and that the shakes get thicker. By the way, the times I've gone it's always been full/busy, but I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes.

All those Red Robin commercials had me feenin' for one of their burgers. We decided to give the new place in Skokie a try. After seeing the line out the door, we asked to sit at the bar so we could just order takeout. My man and I were perplexed as to why anyone would wait for an hour just to get a table at a chain burger joint.  The service was mediocre at best, and there seemed to be a "twice" theme going on -- they asked us to order twice (already ordered...) to pay twice (I already paid...), and then brought our food out twice - once on a plate and then again in a to-go box. The elapsed time between the plate and to-go box was about 20 minutes. Curious... I think I found one more reason to stay in the city.

As soon as we drove by, my friend yelled, "RED ROBIN!!"  The jingle came up and we decided to eat there after our movie right around the corner. The decor is cheesy (as other people have mentioned).  But it kind of reminds you of high school days.  "Random" would be the term I would use to define this place.  Very lively for a family dinner with the kids yet there's still a bar in the middle of the place... (although you're restricted to a max of three alcoholic drinks per person... it IS a family restaurant people!) If that wasn't random enough for you, how about the constant jumps between the hitlist songs right now and then back to random 80s and 90s? The service was probably the worst part.  She disappeared on us for a while... and then it took at least half an hour for her to finally put our order in.  Perhaps it was the fact that she came back every 5 minutes to tell us of a new item that the kitchen has "run out" of...  Of course I don't blame her for the kitchen running out of things but I'd prefer that she found ALL of them and THEN asked for our changes. The burgers came out and since I've never been to a Red Robin before, I had no clue if I got the right one.  It lacked the guacamole that was the main reason I chose that particular burger so I had to ask for it.  It was really good though.  Afterwards, my friends and I realized that our burgers had been switched... so apparently I ate a Blackened Burger instead of the Santa Fe. Since the burger was still delicious, plus bottomless garlic parmesan fries (make sure you ask for the garlic parmesan or you'll get regular for burgers) and you can get a bottomless strawberry lemonade... the experience was still very yummy.  Service needs to be improved though. The girl admit that she only does this on weekends, I'm sure she'll improve eventually. =)
Nice place. Good location. Good prices. Good burgers. Has a lot of selection w/ there burgers.

Burgers aren't bad. The fish platter sucks. I should have stuck with burgers. Service was good. What can you really say. It's just an average american restaurant. Nothing special however, I come back every once in a while.

Great for families. Is the food magical? No. But if you need a spot to take little kids, where they can dine and act like kids and everybody gets a passable meal in a pinch, this is great. (Parents will recognize this category of restaurant need.) They see a table with kids, and a stack of extra napkins gets plunked down with your drinks. They check back OFTEN, but are never pesky; I've never run into so much as mediocre service -- the staff is fantastic. Their kids' menu has lots of healthy options, and the food is fine. There are enough food options overall that you definitely don't HAVE to order a burger. Great drinks, and bonus for adding sweet potato fries to the menu!
I know it's a chain, but you always can get a great burger and bottomless fries has never been a problem with me!

They are a chain, indeed. But a chain worth munching at, if you ask me. They are known for their burgers and bottomless steak fries. Mmmm! The bacon guacamole burger was excellent. They have a variety of bun options, too! They have Red Robin seasoning to use at the tables. It's simply a delicious seasoning salt but an oh so tasty addition to the fries. Onion rings and mozzarella sticks are yummy as well! The kicker for me is the campfire sauce. It comes with the onion rings but I always ask for more with my fries :) Great service at this location and friendly faces.

I was surprised at how good the hamburger was.  Cooked properly and very tasty.  For a chain restaurant, I was very surprised at the quality.  Brought my 5 year old son and it is now one of our favorite places.

We need to expect more from our chain restaurants.  Red Robin is no departure from the ubiquitous explosion of tastelessness; bright colors, junk on the walls, and TV's everywhere (look down) to distract you from their business hand, which is reaching behind you to extract 8 bucks from your wallet for a huge twisty glass of ice, sour mix, and rotgut tequila.  A night at the circus and a C grade burger, topped with bland chili and served with steak fries sprinkled with parsley and imitation Parmesan cheese.  Plenty of salt.

I went here tonight with my 2 boys and my pal and her 4 kids for dinner. The place was pretty crowded, but only waited about 7 minutes for a very large booth. The food was AWESOME!! My oldest boy had the whiskey bbq burger, it was huge and it was all you can eat fries and free refills, so he was VERY happy! My little guy had the chicken tenders with fries... Very good! I had the guacamole burger it was huge, it was a burger with Mayo, lettuce, tomato, red onion, swiss cheese and guacamole and I ate it ALL! they serve it in a piece of wax paper so your sandwich stays together. Service was fantastic! our server was right there when we needed more baskets of fries or refills on our drinks. I will definitely be back, next time I will bring my daughters. oh, they always have a large amount of balloons available for the kids, that is always a plus!

great burgers! i like how there's bottomless wedges too. i've been to a few in IL, and they're all pretty much consistently the same. good service, good food. i oughta stop in for drinks and give that a shot. the freckled lemonade is solidd.

This was my first experience at a Red Robin. My first impression is that the decor is loud and all over the place. They had movie posters, Rock and roll memorabilia and a homoerotic Andy Warhol poster all on the same wall.  The food was good, but quite over priced. I really can't justify $9.00 for a burger. We also split a onion ring appetizer that was $7.00.  They do have a wide variety of different burgers to suit just about any palliate, but none of them are worth the $8.00 to $10.00 price tag.  It was also a very weird crowd demographic. It was a mix between a bar crowd and Chucky Cheese. They serve beer, so I thought that it would be an more adult crowd. But there were kids there having birthday parties. They also did the annoying birthday singing that Bennigan's started.  I have heard good things about Red Robin, and I'm"m glad that I gave it a try, but it's just not my cup of tea.  I guess I will continue to try and find a burger that comes close the the splendor that is Kuma's.

Service is bad.  Waitstaff in a hurry to get rid of us.  Put our check on the table while we were eating. Several times she tried to take away our plate before we are done eating.  The place was not even half full and they seat us next to the kitchen.  Will not go back to this Red Robin.  I give them a zero.

I've been to red robin's before and this one seemed to fair okay with the rest of them. The food seemed to come out on the slow side but not slow enough that I wouldn't go back again. The burgers were on the average side of taste. I ended up with one that I didn't really care for but I think that had less to do with the burger and more to do with what I ordered. The bottomless root beer float was a nice treat but seemed to have been a better idea when we ordered it than after down had disappeared and our stomachs were less than happy. They do also serve booz with their food which was also a nice treat for those of you who like to have a beer with your burger. All in all, they did a good job but a burger joint is a burger joint no matter which way you cut it.

My daughter and I went to Red Robin last Sunday, we just had to have a burger!!!  Our previous experience at this restaurant was a rude and inattentive waiter, but we decided to give it another try.  We walked in just after they opened, we were the first people seated on the restaurant side of the restaurant.  Our waitress came she was nice, friendly attentive (unlike last time) we received our drinks, and placed our order.  While waiting for our food, a single lady came in and was seated 2 booths over, and then a few minutes later and the family with 4 children under the age of 5 came in.  Can you guess where they seated them???  If you guessed RIGHT ACROSS THE AISLE FROM US, you are correct!!!!!!  There must be at least 20-25 other tables, and the hostess insisted on seating them across the aisle from us, even when the Mom asked to be seated near the windows the hostess said here would be fine.  Now I do not blame the parents, nor the kids, for being kids, I blame the hostess and the management.  Within 3 minutes the kids started screaming, and shrieking.  I got up walked toward the kitchen area and asked the gentleman there if he was the manager.  He indicated he was, I explained the situation, and he said he would talk with the hostess.  When I went to sit down the shrieks were continuing and we grabbed our coats and left.   When I got home I emailed the customer service department about our experience, and received 2 phone calls this week from management, which proceeded to eat my voice mail.  Today I got an email from the Customer Service Manager stating the management was trying to contact me, I feel at this point WHY BOTHER???  There is nothing they can do or say at this point that would change my mind about ever going near the restaurant in this lifetime. To say this was a dismal experience would be an understatement.  Does it not occur to businesses that sometimes adults want to eat a meal in peace and quiet without kids screaming in their ears?    I can see at 3:00 in the afternoon, but at 11AM on a Sunday?  We go at that time TO AVOID THE KIDS CHAOS! So I will take my ADULT DOLLARS to another business who's staff knows about respectful seating arrangements. Empty belly, but peace and quiet!

Perfectly middle of the road experience, balanced at the ends by some high points and some points that I would consider to be less than stellar. Objectively: A) The location isn't too bad for either north suburbanites or people who live in the city.  On a Sunday afternoon, it took roughly 30 minutes to get there from the loop via 90/94.  Return trip was about 25 due to less traffic.  Touhy West, take a left at Carpenter, and it's in that little area by BW3 and the movie theater. B) The decor is something that sort of makes you scratch your head.  Upon walking in, you'll notice the following things in no particular order: little crane and arcade games where you can win a prize by lining up moving lines; the lcd tv in the floor; the balloons hanging from the ceiling; the oddly shaped and oddly colored lighting.  The LCD screen in the floor isn't a bad touch especially if there is a wait, but something about the brightly colored conical cylinder lamp coverings sort of screamed "cheap circus."   C) This type of establishment attracts a lot of different people, which means that it has more than just limited appeal.  While eating, I noticed couples that were in their 20's and 30's, families replete with parents, grandparents, and grandkids, older couples (AARP style), and local tweens/teens/late teens.   D) Layout of the restaurant is spacious.  No problems getting back and forth, which is always a plus.   Subjectively: A) Service was attentive and fast, at least from the server that I had.  Quick to bring drinks and food, and also the check.  Not necessarily a bad thing that he brought the check fast, and he did preface by saying, "No hurry."  Personally, I don't mind this type of behavior, but some people may take umbrage to it.  Suck it up.   B) The menu selection is based off of "the world's best burger."  WRONG ANSWER.  A burger consists of the following key items: the bread and the meat.  The bread here was ok.  Not great, not bad.  The meat?  They claim that it's "fresh" and "cooked to order."  You know who else claims that?  Wendy's.  Sure, I had a non-specialty burger.  I wanted a double cheeseburger, no lettuce.  In no particular order, these are the places that make a better double cheeseburger: Chili's, Portillo's, Poag Mahone's, Bar Louie, and Beer Bistro.  My personal stance is that if you can't make a basic burger to an exceptional quality, you can't make a specialty burger to an exceptional quality.  It's not a bad burger, but it's just not great.  Perfectly average, I would say.  But who knows - their other items may be much better.  They do offer chicken sandwiches and other types of entrees, so I would be willing to go back and give those a try. C) A second cornerstone of Red Robin's appeal is their "bottomless fries."  I didn't even want to finish my first order of fries.  Yes, they were thick steak cut fries, and I enjoy those.  But it was clear after eating one or two that that the frying temperature was not high enough and the seasoning was not well defined enough.  The seasoning available at the tables is fairly decent, however.  Unfortunately, the sogginess and paper mache texture of my bottomless fries was a definite turn off.   Overall Ratings: Location: 4 out of 5 Service: 4 out of 5 Decor: 3 out of 5 Atmosphere: 3 out of 5 Food: 2 out of 5 Hype matching expectations: 2 out of 5 Overall: 3 out of 5.   I would be willing to give Red Robin another shot, maybe just with a different (non burger) offering next time.  For now, Chili's, Outback, or Chipotle just down the street would be viable alternatives.

Luv Luv Luv Red Robin.  This is a Skokie secret that is starting to leak out.  Right next door to BWW but with FAR BETTER SERVICE (nicer, faster, more attentive, more kid friendly).  Food is pretty good and they serve way too many free refills on so many food & beverage items - that I can never stick to my diet!  My kids beg for Red Robin and we adults like it too.  The onion ring stack is my downfall.

I really loved the Red Robin in Lincolnshire, so I was hyped when I found out that they opened one in Skokie. I took my hubby there opening night. It was PACKED. We waited about 45 minutes. Our waitress was ok, though you could tell that they were still working things out. The burger itself was not what I remembered and it was really, really hard to eat because my stuff kept falling out. It also had a weird flavor that I couldn't figure out. I did go back a 2nd time and things were a lot better, though the burger still had the weird flavor to it. I am going to go back but I think I will try the chicken next time.
I like Red Robin. This one has hit or miss service. The second batch of fries is always better. The shakes are awesome.

I'm so confused how other people have had bad experiences, but maybe it's because I haven't been here during a "rush?" Since my last review I've been back twice, both to cash in birthday burgers (mine, then my boyfriends).  Staff was very friendly, our burgers were perfect... even the crazy burger my boyfriend "invented". What more can you really ask for?? It's about the same price as Chili's burger and I think any burger you get from Red Robin is going to be better than a burger from a place known for... Chili and ribs.

I've been there twice w/ the dh and kids (2 toddlers).  Since a family meal involves eating on the earlier side, it wasn't crowded when we got there.  Service was great.  We appreciated that they were so quick to get us a high chair and they split our kid's meal into 2 portions which saved us asking for an extra plate.  We'll definitely be back...  oh, only 4 stars b/c last time my chicken sandwich was quite loaded down with stuff and kind of fell apart, but still quite tasty.
